eng: its ultimate objective is to find models that work, whether in skills development or active labour market policies, and to scale these rapidly to reach as many young people as possible.
xho: eyona njongo yayo ipha mbili kukufumana izinto ezi sebenzayo, nokuba kuphu hliso lwezakhono okanye kwi migaqonkqubo yorhwebo labasebenzi, kwaye kunyu swe oku ngokukhawulezi leyo ukuze kufikelele ku lutsha oluninzi kangangoko kunakho.

eng: most importantly, it recognises that young people must be at the centre of any effort to boost youth employment.
xho: okona kubaluleke kakhulu, kukuyiqonda into yokuba abantu abatsha kufuneka babe sembindini wawo nawuphi na umzamo wokunyusa ingqesho yolutsha.

eng: young people are our greatest asset, and our greatest weapon in this fight.
xho: abantu abatsha basesona siphiwo sethu sixabisekileyo, kwaye basesona sixhobo sethu sikhulu kulo mlo.

eng: we salute the resilience of every young person playing their part to build and develop this country.
xho: sothulela umnqwazi wonke umntu osemtsha odlala indima yakhe ekwakheni nasekuphuhliseni eli lizwe.

eng: they are the young people volunteering in our communities, building our country through the presidential employment stimulus, running their own businesses and studying to better themselves.
xho: ngabantu abatsha abavolontiya kwiindawo esihlala kuzo, besakha ilizwe lethu ngemvuselelo yengqesho kamongameli, beqhuba amashishini abo kwaye befundela nokuziphucula.

eng: they are the young people who are forging their own path and bringing their families along with them.
xho: ngabantu abatsha abazenzela eyabo indlela kwaye bathwale neentsapho zabo.

eng: we salute young people who keep working to improve their lives.
xho: sibothulela umnqwazi abantu abatsha abaqhubeka nokusebenza ukuphucula ubomi babo.

eng: young people are doing their part; they need government, and indeed all of society, to do ours.
xho: abantu abatsha abenza eyabo indima; badinga inkxaso kurhulumente kunye noluntu luphela.

eng: our country is going through the most difficult of times, but we are working daily to expand the frontiers of hope.
xho: ilizwe lethu liphantsi kwelona xesha linzima, kodwa sisebenza mihla le ukwandisa ithemba.

eng: we are seeing the green shoots of growth in our economy, and are confident this will translate to better opportunities for all.
xho: siyawabona amahlumelo aluhlaza okukhula kuqoqosho lwethu, kwaye siqinisekile ukuba oku kuya kuguqula amathuba angcono kumntu wonke.

eng: soes must drive economic growth and transformation vukuzenzele unnamed for some years now, south africa’s stateowned enterprises (soes) have mostly been associated in the public eye with state capture, financial mismanagement and inefficiency.
xho: iisoe kufuneka ziqhube ukukhula koqoqosho kunye nenguqu vukuzenzele unnamed sele kuyiminyaka ngoku, amashishi ni aphantsi korhu lumente omzantsi afrika (iisoe) enxulunyaniswa kakhulu namehlo abantu kunye nokubanjwa ngobho ngwana kukarhulumente, ukusetyenziswa gwenxa kwezimali nokungaqhubi kakuhle.

eng: in addition to needing regular bailouts from government, some of the country’s biggest and most important stateowned companies have been struggling to meet their mandates.
xho: ukongeza ekufuneni ukukhululwa rhoqo ngurhulumente, ezinye zeenkampani ezinkulu nokubalulekileyo eziphantsi kukarhulumente bezisokola ukufikelela kwizigunyaziso zazo.

eng: these soes should be at the forefront of economic and social transformation.
xho: ezi soe kufuneka zibe phambili kutshintsho lwezoqoqosho nezentlalo.

eng: they are responsible for providing the infrastructure and the services on which the economy depends, whether it be in the generation of electricity, commuter transport, water provision, freight logistics or telecommunications.
xho: zinoxanduva lokubonelela ngeziseko zoncedo kunye neenkonzo uqoqosho oluxhomekeke kuzo, nokuba kukwenziwa kombane, uthutho lwabakhweli, ubonelelo ngamanzi, ukuthuthwa kwempahla okanye unxibelelwano ngomnxeba.

eng: our approach to state ownership is informed by the need for the effective functioning of key network industries, such as energy and ports, and by the need to ensure that the basic needs of all south africans, particularly the poor, can be met.
xho: indlela yethu yokufumana ubunini bukarhulumente ixhotyiswe yimfuno yokusebenza kwamashishini aphambili othungelwano, afana nawamandla kunye namazibuko, kunye nesidingo sokuqinisekisa ukuba iimfuno ezisisiseko zabo bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika, ngakumbi abahluphekileyo, ziyafezekiswa.

eng: we firmly believe that public ownership is necessary in critical sectors of the economy and that the country needs robust soes that are able to drive economic growth and transformation.
xho: sikholelwa ngokungagungqiyo ukuba ubunini boluntu buyimfuneko kumacandelo abaluleke kakhulu kuqoqosho kwaye ilizwe lifuna iisoe ezomeleleyo ezikwaziyo ukuqhuba ukukhula kwezoqoqosho kunye neenguqu.

eng: this is particularly the case in the delivery of public goods such as electricity and water, where soes are able to pursue a developmental mandate in the public interest as opposed to a purely commercial one.
xho: oku kunjalo ikakhulu ekuhanjisweni kweenkonzo zoluntu ezifana nombane namanzi, apho iisoe zikwazi ukulandela igunya lophuhliso ngokomdla woluntu ngokuchaseneyo nentengiso esulungekileyo.

eng: that is why we have made it a priority of this government to turn these companies around to root out corruption, improve their governance and enable them to play the role they should in driving economic growth and employment creation.
xho: kungenxa yoko le nto sibeke phambili kulo rhulumente ukuba ajike ezi nkampani ukuze zisiphule neengcambu urhwaphilizo, ziphucule ulawulo lwazo kwaye zibenako ukudlala indima ekuqhubeni ukukhula koqoqosho kunye nokudala imisebenzi.

eng: to this end, we have embarked upon a number of reforms to strengthen these soes so that they can produce the results that the country needs and expects.
xho: ukuza kuthi ga ngoku, sithathe iinguqu ezininzi ukomeleza ezi soe ukuze zikwazi ukuvelisa iziphumo ilizwe elizifunayo nokulindelekileyo.

eng: one of the most important reforms is in the energy sector.
xho: olunye uhlaziyo olubalulekileyo kakhulu lukwicandelo lezamandla.

eng: we have begun the process of restructuring eskom into three different soes, responsible for generation, transmission and distribution, respectively.
xho: siqalisile ngenkqubo yokwakha ngokutsha ueskom abe ziisoe ezintathu, ezijongene nokuveliswa, ukuhanjiswa nokusasazwa ngokulandelelana kwazo.

eng: this is because the previous structure of eskom was illsuited for a changing energy landscape.
xho: kungenxa yokuba ulwakhiwo lwangaphambili lukaeskom lwalungakulungelanga ukutshintsha imbonakalo yamandla.

eng: it had become inefficient and costly and was not sufficiently transparent.
xho: lungasebenzi kakuhle, lubiza kakhulu kwaye lungabonakali ngokucacileyo.

eng: the establishment of a transmission entity in particular will mean that eskom will be able to purchase power from a broader range of providers, both private and public.
xho: ukusekwa kwecandelo lokuhanjiswa kombane kuya kuthetha ukuba ueskom uza kuba nakho ukuthenga amandla kuluhlu olubanzi lwababoneleli, abucala nakarhulumente.

eng: this will improve transparency, increase competitiveness and promote the purchase of lowestcost electricity.
xho: oku kuza kuphucula ukungafihli, kunyuse ukhuphiswano kukhuthaze ukuthengwa kombane onexabiso eliphantsi.

eng: through the renewable energy independent power producers programme, there has been significant private investment in energy generation.
xho: ngenkqubo yabavelisi abazimeleyo bamandla avuselelekayo, kubekho utyalomali lwabucala olubalulekileyo ekuvelisweni kwamandla.

eng: with the proposal to raise the licencing exemption for embedded generation – where companies produce electricity for themselves and other commercial users – from 1mw to 100mw, we can expect even more private investment.
xho: ngesindululo sokunyusa ukukhutshwa kwamaphephamvume kwiinkampani ezixhomekekileyo ngemveliso apho iinkampani zizivelisela umbane ngokwazo kunye nabanye abasebenzisi borhwebo ukusuka kwi1mw ukuya kwi100mw, sinokulindela utyalomali lwabucala ngakumbi.

eng: this is vital at a time when the country is suffering from severe and sustained electricity shortages and where neither eskom nor the state is able to invest in new generation capacity.
xho: oku kubalulekile ngexesha apho ilizwe lithwaxwa kukunqongophala okukhulu kombane ozinzileyo nalapho ueskom norhulumente bengenakho ukutyala imali kumthamo omtsha wokuvelisa.

eng: importantly, these reforms will give eskom the space to address its financial and operational challenges.
xho: okubalulekileyo, olu hlengahlengiso luya kunika ueskom isithuba sokujongana nemiceli mngeni yakhe yezemali kunye nokusebenza.

eng: another critical reform is the establishment of the national ports authority as an independent subsidiary of transnet.
xho: olunye uhlengahlengiso olubalulekileyo kukusekwa kwegunya lezibuko lesizwe njengenkampani ezimeleyo yetransnet.

eng: this a crucial part of transnet’s broader strategy to revitalise our logistics infrastructure.
xho: eli licandelo elibalulekileyo lesicwangciso esibanzi sikatransnet sokuvuselela iziseko zophuhliso.

eng: transnet plans to invest r100 billion over the next five years in upgrading its infrastructure across the ports system.
xho: abakwatransnet baceba ukutyala imali ezibhiliyoni zeerandi kule minyaka mihlanu izayo kuphuculo lweziseko zayo kuzo zonke iinkqubo zamazibuko.

eng: this will make our ports more efficient and our exports more competitive, and benefit the entire economy.
xho: oku kuyakwenza ukuba amazibuko ethu asebenze ngakumbi kwaye ukuthunyelwa kweempahla kwamanye amazwe kukhuphisane ngakumbi, kwaye kuncede uqoqosho luphela.

eng: for the ordinary consumer, it will mean reduced prices in the long term for many of our goods.
xho: kumthengi oqhelekileyo, oko kuya kuthetha ukwehla kwamaxabiso kwixesha elide kwizinto zethu ezininzi.

eng: for our exporters, it will mean greater competitiveness in global markets.
xho: kubathumeli mpahla ngaphandle, oko kuya kuthetha ukhuphiswano olukhulu kwiimarike zehlabathi.

eng: as our exports grow, our economy will expand and create more jobs.
xho: njengokuba imveliso yethu ethunyelwa kumazwe angaphandle ikhula, uqoqosho lwethu luza kwanda luze ludale imisebenzi emininzi.

eng: more efficient ports will make the entire economy work better – and as port volumes increase, jobs will be created at the ports themselves.
xho: amazibuko asebenza ngokukuko aya kwenza uqoqosho luphela lusebenze ngcono kwaye njengoko amanani asebenzisa izibuko esanda, imisebenzi iyakuvela kumazibuko ngokwawo.

eng: establishing the national ports authority as a transnet subsidiary with its own board will, among other things, mean that revenues generated by the ports can be used to replace old equipment and upgrade and expand our ports, work which has been delayed for more than a decade.
xho: ukuseka igunya lezibuko lesizwe njengenkxaso yetransnet nebhodi yayo, phakathi kwezinye izinto, kuya kuthetha ukuba inge niso eveliswe ngamazibuko inokusetyenziselwa ukubu yisela izixhobo ezindala ku nye nokuphucula nokwa ndisa amazibuko ethu, u msebenzi othe walibaziseka ngaphezulu kweminyaka elishumi.

eng: among other things, these reforms will encourage greater private investment in the country’s economic infrastructure.
xho: phakathi kwezinye izinto, ezi nguqu ziya kukhuthaza utyalo mali lwabucala olukhulu kwiziseko zophu hliso zelizwe.

eng: some people have expressed concerns that this will diminish the importance or reduce the value of soes.
xho: abanye abantu bavakalise inkxalabo yokuba oku kuya kunciphisa ukuba luleka okanye kunciphise ixa biso leesoe.

eng: prevent identity theft kgaogelo letsebe shenki mabitsela (28) is all too aware of identity theft and the crimes relating to it, as he has been a victim of it.
xho: khusela ubusela besazisi kgaogelo letsebe ushenki mabitsela (28) ubazi bonke ubusela besazisi kunye nolwaphulo mthetho olunxulumene nabo, nanje ngoko ebekhe walixhoba.

eng: mabitsela, from modimolle in limpopo, applied for a loan at a bank in november 2020, but was told he was overindebted and didn’t qualify.
xho: umabitsela, wasemodimolle elimpopo, ufake isicelo semalimboleko ebhankeni ngeyenkanga ka2020, kodwa waxelelwa ukuba unamatyala amaninzi kwaye akakufanelanga ukufumana imalimboleko.

eng: "i went to apply for a shortterm loan as i needed to make ends meet after being retrenched in june 2020. to my surprise, i was told i did not qualify.
xho: "ndiye ndayokufaka isicelo semalimboleko yexeshana kuba bendifuna imali yokuziphilisa emva kokudendwa ngeyesilimela ka2020.

eng: "i initially thought it was because of my unstable income, but it wasn’t.
xho: ndothuka xa ndixelelwa ukuba andifanelekanga.

eng: i knew i only had one clothing account and no other debt, so i asked for a printout of my profile," he says.
xho: "ekuqaleni ndacinga ukuba kungenxa yomvuzo wam ongazinzanga, kodwa bekungenjalo.

eng: mabitsela saw that two cellphone contracts, a r65 000 bank loan and numerous re tail shop accounts had been opened in his name.
xho: umabitsela ubone ukuba kuvulwe izivumelwano ezibini zeeselula, imalimboleko yebhanki engamar65 000 kunye namatyala amaninzi eevenkile avulwe ngegama lakhe.

eng: the debt was close to r100 000.
xho: ityala laliphantse lafikelela kwir100 000.

eng: "just before the national level 5 lockdown, i lost my id book.
xho: "phambi nje kokuba kuvalwe kwinqanaba lesi5 kuzwelonke, ndilahlekelwe yincwadi yam yesazisi.

eng: i thought it was somewhere in the house and wasn’t too worried because i had my smart card id," he says.
xho: ndandicinga ukuba ikwenye indawo kwalapha endlini kwaye andabi naxhala kakhulu kuba bendinesazisi sam sekhadi,"utshilo.

eng: after realising that someone was creating debt in his name, mabitsela opened a case of stolen identity at the south african police service (saps).
xho: emva kokubona ukuba kukho umntu ovula amatyala egameni lakhe, umabitsela wavula ityala lesazisi esibiweyo kwinkonzo yamapolisa omzantsi afrika (isaps).

eng: he had to write an affidavit stating that he lost his identity book and take it to credi tors with his case number to avoid being blacklisted.
xho: kwafuneka abhale ingxelo efungelweyo echaza ukuba ulahlekelwe yincwadi yakhe yesazisi ze ayise kubantu abatyalwayo kunye nenombolo yamapolisa avule ngayo ityala ukunqanda ukubekwa kuludwe lwabantu abangahlawuli matyala.

eng: mabitsela’s experience is not unique.
xho: amava kamabitsela awohlukanga kwawabanye.

eng: according to the south african fraud prevention service’s (safps) 2020 fraud report, last year fraud increased by 161% in the eastern cape and 120% in gauteng.
xho: ngokwengxelo yobuqhetseba yasemzantsi afrika (isafps) ka2020, kunyaka ophelileyo ubuqhetseba bonyuke nge161% empuma koloni nange120% egauteng.

eng: manie van schalkwyk, the executive director of the safps, says: "the most worrying is that impersonation fraud – otherwise known as identity fraud – has increased by an alarming 337%."
xho: umanie van schalkwyk, umphathi olawulayo wesafps, uthi: "eyona nto ixhalabisayo bubuqhetseba bokuzenza omnye umntu oko kubizwa njengobuqhetseba besazisi bunyuke ngama337%."

eng: van schalkwyk says people must report a lost or stolen id book or passport immediately.
xho: uvan schalkwyk uthi abantu mabaxele malunga nokulahleka kweencwadi zezazisi okanye iipaspoti ngokukhawuleza.

eng: support for businesses and workers vukuzenzele unnamed starting and building a business is a lot like raising a family.
xho: uxhaso lwamashishini kunye nabasebenzi vukuzenzele unnamed ukuqala nokwakha ishishini kufana nokukhulisa umntwana.

eng: it takes time, patience, con stant support and consistent nurturing from infancy to maturity.
xho: kuthatha ixesha, umonde, inkxaso ethe gqolo kwakunye nokumkhulisa ngononophelo eseliyuku ade abemdala.

eng: for many business owners, seeing a business that you grew from scratch struggling to survive, or even being forced to close its doors, is heartbreaking.
xho: kosomashishini abaninzi iyophula kakhulu intliziyo into yokubona ishishini lakho owalisusa phantsi lijongene nemicelimngeni yokukhula, okanye xa lijongene nee ngxaki ezinyanzelisa ukuba livale iingcango zalo.

eng: since the onset of the covid19 pandemic, this has sadly been the situation facing many businesses both large and small, not just in our country but around the world.
xho: kususela oko kwaqala ubhubhane wecovid19, ibeyimeko ebuhlungu ejongene namashi shini amaninzi kuquka amancinane kunye namakhulu, kwaye le meko ingekho buhlungu kweli lizwe lethu qha kodwa kumhlaba wonke jikelele.

eng: the pandemic and the meas ures we have had to take to contain the spread of the virus have had a detrimental impact on businesses.
xho: amanyathelo ekuye kwafu neka siwathathe ukuze sinqande ukunwenwa kwalo bhubhane wentsholongwane abenefuthe elibi kumashishini.

eng: in dealing with the pandemic we have sought to adopt an evidencebased approach in both policy and practice, con sidering scientific research, clinical expertise and capabil ities, and impact on all sectors of the population.
xho: ukujongana nalo bhubhane siye safuna ukusebenzisa ubu ngqina obusisiseko xa siqulunkqa umgaqonkqubo kunye nokusebenza.

eng: we have sought to have a balance between saving lives and preserving livelihoods.
xho: ngokuthi siqwalasele uphando lwenzululwazi, ubu chule bezonyango kunye namandla esinawo, kwakunye nefuthe kuwo wonke amacandelo oluntu.

eng: we have sought to mitigate the impact of the successive lockdown restrictions on people’s livelihoods, or risk a second and possibly worse epidemic of poverty and hunger in future.
xho: siye sazama ukufumana isilinganiselo phakathi kokugcina ubomi kunye nokugcina indlela yokuphila.

eng: in the earliest days last year, we introduced measures such as the covid temporary employer/employee relief scheme (ters), the covid19 loan guarantee scheme and various mechanisms to support small businesses to provide immediate and shortterm relief to burdened employees and business owners.
xho: siye sazama ukunciphisa ifuthe elingalandela ezimpilweni zabantu ngenxa yemiqathango yokumiswa ngxi kweentshu kumo, okanye umngcipheko wolunye ubhubhane lwesibini, mhlawumbi indyikitya yobhu bhane olubi nangakumbi lwentlupheko nendlala kwilixa elizayo.

eng: in addition, the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and broadening access to existing social grants provided lifelines to indigent individuals and families.
xho: kwiintsuku zokuqala kunyaka ophelileyo, sothula amanya thelo afana nesibonelelo sethutyana sabaqeshi nabasebenzi icovid temporary employer/employee relief scheme (ters) kwakunye nesikimu esisisiqinisekiso semalimboleko nezinye ke iindlela zokuxhasa amashishini asakhasayo ngokuwanika isibonelelo sethutyana esikhawulezileyo ukuze sothule umthwalo emagxeni wabase benzi noosomashishini.

eng: as part of that plan, we introduced the presidential employment stimulus to provide income and livelihood support to millions of beneficiaries.
xho: ukongezelela, kwabakhona uncedo olukhethekileyo lwezibo nelelo sezentlalo ngelokwandisa ukufikelela kwizibonelelo ebe sele zikhona kakade, ukuze kubonelelwe iintsapho nabantu abahlelelekileyo ngeendlela zokuphila.

eng: the rapid rise in infections being fueled by the new delta variant necessitated the imposing of tighter restric tions on the movement of persons, on the operation of certain businesses and on public gatherings, among others.
xho: iingcali ezi lulutsha zona zinikwe amathuba kumacandelo okuphuculwa kweziseko zophuhliso, ukulo ndolozwa kwendalo namanye ke amacandelo.

eng: just as we did at the beginning of the pandemic, we engaged in deliberations with all social partners, business, labour and civil society to see what financially sustainable measures we could intro duce to support businesses and individuals in distress at this time.
xho: zikhona ke nezalathisi ezibonisa ukuba uqoqosho luthe chu ukuvuseleleka, ngokukhula kwanokuqalwa kwemise benzi kumacandelo amaninzi, ukususela kwimveliso ukuya kwizimbiwa nezolimo.

eng: the negotiations at the national economic development and labour council resulted in consen sus that the most practical and financially sustainable measure that can provide urgent relief is extending the covid19 ters scheme to sectors that have been affected by the adjusted level 4 restrictions.
xho: kwangaxesha linye, siyazi ukuba oku kujonga ‘ngeliso elikhulu’ akubathuthuzeli ncam abasebenzi noosomashishini abachaphazeleke ngokunga thethekiyo, ukususela kulo nyaka ogqithileyo nesiqingatha.

eng: over the past year, we have also been working consist ently to protect vulnerable workers whose jobs were at risk, particularly in hardhit sectors like retail, food and beverage and the metals industry.
xho: ukunyuka ngokukhawuleza kosulelo, kusenziwa nangakumbi intsholongwana entsha idelta kunyanzelise izithintelo ezingqongqo kwiintshukumo zabantu, ukusebenza kwamanye amashishini, kunye neendibano zoluntu.

eng: through processes facili tated by the commission for conciliation, mediation and arbitration, some 58 000 jobs have been saved.
xho: noko ibingezozigqibo zilula ukuzithatha ezi, ngenxa yo kwazi ulwamvila oluzokuvakala kwiindlela zokuphila kwabantu.

eng: with the pandemic show ing no immediate signs of ending, businesses and work ers remain vulnerable.
xho: njengoko senza njalo ekuqaleni kwalo bhubhane, sathethathethana noogxa bethu kwezentlalontle, amashishini, ezabasebenzi nemibutho yo luntu.

eng: it is thanks to the social com pacts we continue to forge that government, business and labour have been able to work together to buffer work ers and businesses from the pandemic’s harsh economic impacts.
xho: sikhangela ukuba ngeyiphi indlela esinokuzisa ngayo uzinzo kwezemali esinokuxhasa ngalo amashishini nabantu ngelixesha loxinzelelo.

eng: for now, our priority is saving lives, and ensuring that we provide the necessary support, within our means, to prevent more businesses closing down and more jobs being lost.
xho: iingxoxo kwibhunga lophuhliso loqoqosho lwesizwe kunye nabasebenzi zaba neziphumo zesivumelwano esithi, awona manyathelo asebenzayo nangakwazi ukuzisa uzinzo olukhawulezileyo kwezemali kukwandisa ixesha lesibonelelo secovid19 ters kumacandelo achaphazeleki leyo zizithintelo ezibuyekiziweyo kwisigaba sesine sokumiswa kweentshukumo.

eng: sandf fights covid19 more matshediso the south african national defence force (sandf) is helping fight the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic in gauteng, which is currently the epicentre of the third wave.
xho: isandf ilwa necovid19 more matshediso umkhosi wokhuse lo wesizwe wase mzantsi afrika (isandf) uncedisana nokulwa nesifo sentsho longwane yecorona (icovid19) kwiphondo lasegauteng, nekulelona phondo lingumbindi wetyeli lesithathu lale ntsho longwane okwangoku.

eng: the sandf is assisting with mass community test ing, screening and contact tracing, and is also lending a hand at hospitals.
xho: isandf incedisa ngoku vavanywa koluntu oluninzi, ukuhlola kunye nokulandelelwa komkhondo, kwakunye nokuncedisa nakuyo nantoni na ezibhedlele.

eng: the south african military health service was deployed in the province to ease the burden on healthcare workers.
xho: umkhosi wasemzantsi afrika wenkonzo yezempilo, uthunyelwe kweli phondo ukuze uphungule umthwalo emagxeni abasebenzi bezempilo.

eng: a medical task group has been stationed at chris hani baragwanath academic hospital in johannesburg.
xho: kubekwe iqela lomsebe nzi wezonyango kwisibhe dlele ichris hani baragwanath academic hospital esiserhawutini.

eng: with gauteng recording the highest number of covid19 cases during the third wave, the hospital was named a pro vincial health facility and is now dedicated to patients with covid19.
xho: emva kokuba iphondo legauteng libhengezwe njengelona phondo elinamanani aphezulu ecovid19 ngexesha letyeli lesithathu.

eng: before assuming their duties, the medical task group had to be vaccinated so that they could be kept safe while handling the increased number of positive cases and hospital admissions.
xho: ngaphambi kokuba iqela lomsebenzi wezonyango liqale umsebenzi walo, liye lagonywa ukuze lihlale likhuselekile ngelixa lisebenza ngamanani onyukayo abantu abosulelekileyo kunye nabamkwelwa esibhedlele.

eng: medical task group commander colonel fezeka mabona, who is a professional nurse, says she works on the ground with other members of the group.
xho: inkomanda yeli qela lomse benzi wonyango ukholoneli fezeka mabona, ongumongikazi oqeqeshiweyo, uthi usebenza namanye amalungu eqela ngqo kanye apho uncedo lufuneka khona.

eng: "the group comprises various healthcare professionals, including nurses, doctors, clinical associates and occu pational health and safety professionals," she says.
xho: "eli qela liqulathe abasebenzi abaqeqeshiweyo kweze mpilo ngokwahlukahlukeneyo, kuquka abongikazi, oogqirha, abasebenzi bezonyango kunye nabo abaqeqeshelwe ezempilo nokhuseleko emsebenzini," utshilo.

eng: the majority of the nurses have nursing qualifications at the degree level, with different specialities, including primary healthcare.
xho: uninzi lwabongikazi luneziqu zokonga kwinqanaba lesi danga, kumakhono ohlukeneyo aquka ukhathalelo lwempilo oluphambili.

eng: "some nurses are theatre tr ained.
xho: "abanye abongikazi baqeqeshelwe ukusebenza ethiyetha.

eng: all of us have worked as general nurses, midwives, nurse educators and managers in both the military and public health system," she adds.
xho: sonke sisebenzile njengabongikazi ngokuthe gabalala, ababelekisi, ooti tshala babongikazi kunye nabaphathi kuzo zombini iinkqubo, emkhosini nakwimpilo yoluntu," uqhubeke watsho.

eng: the group is divided into task teams and work with the hospital staff in shifts, according to the demand at the facility.
xho: iqela lohlukene ngama qelana emisebenzi kwaye lisebenza ngokutshintshana ngamaxesha nabasebenzi besibhedlela ngokweemfuno zecandelo.

eng: the team is currently providing healthcare services in six wards.
xho: okwangoku eli qela linikezela ngeenkonzo zonyango kwiiwadi ezisithandathu.

eng: "the hospital staff is quite low to handle the number of cases at the moment.
xho: "ngokwalo mzuzu inani labasebenzi liphantsi kunelo elingakwazi ukulawula inani labantu obosuleleki leyo.

eng: it is very important for us to try as much as we can to assist them in order for all of us to avoid further strain on the health care system," says mabona.
xho: kubaluleke kakhulu ukuba sizame kanga ngoko esinako ukunce disana nabo ukuze sonke sinqande ukongezeleleka koxinzelelo kwinkqubo yezempilo," utsho njalo umabona.

eng: inclusive communities critical to sa’s success vukuzenzele unnamed while the violence and destruction that engulfed parts of kwazulunatal and gauteng recently caused much damage to property and livelihoods, it also had a huge impact on the cohesion of our communities.
xho: umanyano loluntu lubalulekile kakhulu kwimpumelelo yomzantsi afrika vukuzenzele unnamed ngelixa ubundlo b o n g e l a k u n y e nokutshatyala l i s w a o k u g u b u n g e l e iindawo ezithile zakwa zulunatali naserhawu tini kutshanje zibange le umonakalo omkhulu kwimpahla nakwiindlela zokuphila, ziye zanefuthe elikhulu kumanyano lolu ntu lwethu.

eng: this was most evident in the tragic events that took place in and around phoenix in ethekwini.
xho: oku kwacaca gca kwizi ganeko ezimanyukunyezi ezenzeke kwiindawo eziku futshane nephoenix kunye nasethekwini.

eng: during some of the worst unrest in our democracy, and in a climate already thick with suspicion and paranoia, people that had lived sidebyside in relative peace turned on each other.
xho: ngexesha lezidubedube ezithile ezimbi kakhulu kwintando yesininzi yethu, nakwimo esele igcwaliswe kukusola kunye nokunga thembani kwabantu, abantu ebebehlala kwindawo enye ngoxolo baye bajikelana.

eng: there is still much we have to unearth about the events that took place.
xho: kusekuninzi ekufuneka sikuvumbululile malunga neziganeko ezenzekileyo.

eng: the proliferation of fake news, doctored images and incorrect information has made it difficult to separate fact from fiction.
xho: ukwanda ngokukhawuleza kweendaba zobuxoki, imi fanekiso engcikivayo kunye neenkcukacha ezingachane kanga zenze kwabanzima ukwahlula phakathi kwenyani nobuxoki.

eng: but we do know from official reports and personal accounts that people were racially profiled at illegal roadblocks, some people were pulled out of cars and beaten, and some were humiliated and degraded.
xho: k o d w a s i y a z i n g o k w e e ngxelo zomthetho nakulwazi lwethu ukuba abantu bebe bukulwa ngokobuhlanga kwiindlela ezivalwe ngo kungekho semthethweni, abanye abantu bakhutshwa ezimotweni babethwa, kwaye abanye bathotywa isidima kwaye becekelwa phantsi.

eng: several people were killed.
xho: abantu abaninzi babulawa.

eng: much of what has happened is the inevitable outcome when people take the law into their own hands.
xho: u n i n z i l w e z i n t o e z e nzekileyo ziziphumo ezingenakuphepheka xa abantu bezithathela umthetho ezandleni zabo.

eng: vigilantism will not be tolerated in this country.
xho: ukuthathela umthetho ezandleni akuzu kunyamezeleka kweli lizwe.

eng: it is criminal and it is dangerous.
xho: kululwaphulomthetho kwaye kuyingozi.

eng: now that calm has been restored to the affected areas, our law enforcement agencies are investigating all acts of criminality.
xho: ngoku kuba ukuzola kubuyiselwe esiqhelweni kwiindawo ezichaphaze lekileyo, iiarhente zethu zogcinomthetho ziphanda ngazo zonke izenzo zolwaphulomthetho.

eng: a team of detectives has been assigned to deal with the murders and are working closely with local communities.
xho: iqela labacuphi linikwe umsebenzi wokujongana nokubulala kwaye lise benza ngokusondeleleneyo noluntu lwasekuhlaleni.

eng: there have been arrests and those responsible will face the full might of the law.
xho: k u b e k h o u k u b a n j w a kwabantu kwaye abo babandakanyekayo baza kujongana nengalo yomthetho.

eng: much of the narrative around the events in phoenix has been dominated by attempts to turn one race against another.
xho: uninzi lwengxelo ezingqonge iziganeko zasephoenix bezilawulwa ziinzame zokuthelekisa iintlanga ezahlukeneyo.

eng: it has been stoked by anonymous people on social media and in messaging groups making outrageous claims and calling for revenge.
xho: bezivuselelwa ngabantu abangaziwayo kumajelo eendaba zoluntu nakumaqela emiyalezo enza amabango acaphukisayo kwaye beme melela impindezelo.

eng: there is an attempt to present this as a sign of imploding race relations between african and indian communities.
xho: k u k h o i i n z a m e z o k u b o nisa oku njengophawu lokuchithachitha ubudle lwane beentlanga phakathi koluntu oluntsundu kunye nolwamandiya.

eng: just as there were people who tried to exploit people’s vulnerability and cause mayhem, there are those who want to present criminal acts in racial terms to serve their own purposes.
xho: njengokuba babekhona abantu ababezama ukuxha phaza abantu abasesichengeni kwaye babangele isiphithiphithi, kukho abo bebefuna ukubonisa izenzo zolwaphulomthetho ngoko buhlanga ukuze bafezekise iinjongo zabo.

eng: they will not succeed.
xho: abazu kuphumelela.

eng: south africa has a proud history of principled nonracialism and working class solidarity.
xho: umzantsi afrika unembali yokuzingca yokuziphatha ngokungacaluli ngoko buhlanga kunye nobumbano lwabasebenzi.

eng: african and indian communities were united in the struggle against apartheid and, together with other communities, remain committed to a united and democratic society.
xho: uluntu oluntsundu kunye nolwa mandiya lwalumanyene kumzabalazo wokulwa nocalucalulo kwaye, kunye nolunye uluntu, bahlala bezibophelele kwintlalo emanyeneyo neyentando yesininzi.

eng: in response to the fear and mistrust, the people of phoenix and the neighbouring areas of bhambayi, zwelitsha and amaoti are working to repair the damage.
xho: u k u p h e n d u l a k u l o y i k o nokungathembani, abantu basephoenix kunye neendawo ezingabamelwane zasebhambayi, ezwelitsha naseamaoti zisebenzela uku lungisa loo monakalo.

eng: aided by a peace forum established by the south african police service in partnership with community leaders, the communities have come together to support those affected by the unrest and to open channels of dialogue.
xho: bencediswa liqonga loxolo elasekwa yinkonzo yama polisa omzantsi afrika ngentsebenziswano kunye neenkokheli zoluntu, aba hlali baye badibana ngoku nika inkxaso kwabo bantu bachatshazelwe zizidube dube kwaye bavule amajelo engxoxo.

eng: this is not the only part of the country that is confronted with such challenges.
xho: le ayiyiyo kuphela indawo yelizwe ejongene nemicelimngeni enjalo.

eng: our efforts to build integrated communities are frustrated by the legacy of apartheid planning and persistent inequality.
xho: iinzame zethu zokwakha uluntu oluhlangeneyo zityhafiswa lilifa lesicwangciso socalucalulo kunye nokungalingani okuzingi sayo.

eng: our cities, towns and rural areas are still all divided by both race and class.
xho: izixeko zethu, iidolophu kunye neendawo zase maphandleni zisahlulahlulwe ngokobuhlanga nangokodidi lwentlalo.

eng: this discourages cooperation and understanding, and hampers the work we have undertaken to build a nonracial society.
xho: oku kuyayityhafisa intsebe nziswano kunye nokuqondana, kwaye kudodobalisa umsebenzi esiwenzileyo wokwakha uluntu olungenacalulo ngokobuhlanga.

eng: correcting these spatial distortions must be part of our work of building an inclusive economy and improving the living conditions of all south africans.
xho: u k u l u n g i s w a k o l u p h a zanyiso lwendawo kufuneka kube yinxalenye yomsebenzi wethu wokwakha uqoqosho olubandakanya wonke umntu noluphucula iimeko zokuphila zabantu bonke basemzantsi afrika.

eng: it is why we are working to build flourishing township and rural economies, and focusing on the growth of small businesses.
xho: yiyo loo nto sisebenzela ukwakha uqoqosho olukhulayo ezilokishini nasemaphandleni, kwaye sigxile ekukhuleni kwama shishini amancinane.

eng: it is why we are investing in infrastructure in these areas and working to improve the provision of services.
xho: yiyo loo nto sityala imali kwi ziseko zophuhliso kwezi ndawo kwaye sisebenzela ukuphucula ukubonelelwa kweenkonzo.

eng: at the same time, we need to confront racism in our society.
xho: ngaxesha nye, kufuneka sijongane nobuhlanga kuluntu lwethu.

eng: we need to have honest conversations not only about our attitudes to one another, but also about the material conditions that divide us.
xho: kufuneka sithethe ngokunyanise kileyo kungekuphela nje ngeembono zethu komnye nomnye, kodwa nangeemeko ezibonakalayo ezisahlulahlulayo.

eng: for as long as the division of wealth and opportunity in south africa is largely still determined by race and gender, we will not be able to build a truly united nation.
xho: xa kungona ulwahlulo lobutyebi kunye namathuba emzantsi afrika zisagqityelwa ikakhulu bubuhlanga kunye nesini, asinakho ukwakha isizwe esimanyene ngokwenene.

eng: the events in phoenix are a painful reminder of how much work we still need to do to build inclusive communities that have successfully broken down the boundaries of the past.
xho: i z i g a n e k o z a s e p h o e nix zisisikhumbuzo esibuhlungu sokuba unga kanani umsebenzi ekusa funeka siwenzile ukwakha uluntu olubandakanye kayo oluye lwachitha chitha ngempumelelo imi qobo yexesha elidlulileyo.

eng: these events also demonstrate how determined some people are to divide us, and how we need to do everything we can to resist them.
xho: ezi ziganeko zikwabo nisa indlela abanye abantu abazimisele ngayo eku sahlulahluleni, kunye nendlela ekufuneka senze ngayo ngokusemandleni ethu ukumelana nabo.

eng: it is our collective responsibility to support these communities in ethekwini and elsewhere in their journey towards reconciliation and healing.
xho: luxanduva lwethu oludi beneyo ukuxhasa aba bahlali basethekwini nakwezinye iindawo kuhambo lwabo oluya kuxolelwaniso nase kuphileni.

eng: help learners cope with covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed parents and teachers can help learners cope with the anxiety and depression they are experiencing because of the coronavirus disease pandemic.
xho: nceda abafundi ukuba bajongane necovid19 more matshediso bazali kunye nootitshala bangabanceda abafundi ukuba bakwazi ukumelana nenkxalabo kunye nonxunguphalo abanalo ngenxa yobhubhane wesifo sentsholongwane yecorona .

eng: more matshediso learners have been faced with many challenges as a result of the coronavirus disease (covid19) and the lockdown restrictions.
xho: abafundi bajongene nemicelimngeni emininzi ngenxa yesifo sentsholongwane yecorona ( i covid19) kunye nezithintelo zoku valwa mba kweentshu kumo.

eng: there has been constant change in the learning environment at south africa’s schools, which can leave learners feeling anxious and fearful.
xho: kubekho utshintsho rhoqo kummandla wokufunda kwizikolo zomzantsi afrika, ezinokushiya abafundi beziva bexhalabile kwaye benoloyiko.

eng: learners have had to navigate a new world of online or delayed learning, social isolation, loss, grief and trauma, all of which can cause increased anxiety and depression.
xho: abafundi kuye kwafu neka ukuba balungiselele ihlabathi elitsha lokufunda ngeintanethi okanye uku funda okulibazisekileyo, ukuhlala bodwa, ilahleko, ukubindeka kunye noko thuka, konke oku kunoku bangela ukwanda kwenkxa labo kunye nonxunguphalo.

eng: counselling psychologist boitumelo tlhapane, who works for the inclusive education unit at the free state department of education, says feeling anxious or depressed during these trying times is understandable.
xho: ingcali yoluleko lwengqondo uboitumelo tlhapane, ose benzela icandelo lemfundo ebandakanya wonke umntu kwisebe lezemfundo efreyi stata, uthi ukuziva uxhalabile okanye unxunguphele ngala maxesha obunzima kuyaqondakala.

eng: "for about ayearandahalf now, learners have had to adjust to a new way of learning, with less contact and teaching time.
xho: "malunga nonyaka onesi qingatha ngoku, abafundi kuye kwafuneka ukuba baqhele indlela entsha yoku funda, enexesha elincinane lokudibana nootitshala kunye nelokufunda.

eng: "many have had to study independently, while living with uncertainty about their future and the impact of covid19 on their hopes and dreams, family and social life," says tlhapane.
xho: "abaninzi kuye kwa funeka ukuba bafunde ngokuzimeleyo, ngelixa bephila ngokungaqiniseki ngekamva labo nangefuthe lecovid19 kumathemba nakumaphupha abo, kusapho kunye nobomi bentlalo yabo," utshilo utlhapane.

eng: how to cope she explains that anxiety is the fear of or worrying about something that has an uncertain outcome.
xho: indlela yokumelana nale meko ucacisa ukuba inkxa labo luloyiko okanye ukukhathazeka ngento ene siphumo esithandabuzekayo.

eng: to help learners to cope, she offers the following advice: understand that it is normal to be anxious or fearful.
xho: ukunceda abafundi bakwazi ukumelana nale meko, unikezela ngale ngcebiso: qonda ukuba yinto eqhele kileyo ukuba nenkxalabo okanye ukuba noloyiko.

eng: this does not mean that you are weak.
xho: oku akuthethi ukuba ubuthathaka.

eng: it is okay to not be okay.
xho: kulungile ukungaziva ulungile.

eng: what you do with your fear is what is important.
xho: into oyenzayo ngo loyiko lwakho yiyo into ebalulekileyo.

eng: are you obeying all the covid19 rules that have put in place to protect you and others?
xho: ingaba uyayithobela yonke imithetho yecovid19 emiselwe ukuba ikhusele wena kunye nabanye abantu?

eng: what else can you do to ensure your and others’ safety?
xho: yintoni enye into ongayenza ukuqinisekisa ukhuseleko lwakho nolwabanye abantu?

eng: do you have reliable information about covid19 in case you or a loved one gets infected?
xho: ingaba unazo iinkcuka cha ezithembekileyo malunga necovid19 xa kunokwenzeka ukuba wena okanye umntu omthandayo osuleleke?

eng: do you have the support of teachers, family and friends to help you when you feel uncertain or stressed or anxious?
xho: ingaba unayo inkxaso yoo titshala, eyosapho kunye neyabahlobo yokukunceda xa uziva unentandabuzo okanye unonxunguphalo okanye unenkxalabo?

eng: this is very important.
xho: oku kubaluleke kakhulu.

eng: teachers can also provide noncontact support and learning through online material and study groups; by setting up reminders to motivate learners to study at home; and by encouraging them to communicate their fears about schooling.
xho: ootitshala banokunikezela ngenkxaso kunye nokufunda okungenandibano yobuqu ngokusebenzisa izinto zeintanethi kunye namaqela okufunda; ngokumisela izikhumbuzi zokukhuthaza abafundi ukuba bafundele ekhaya; nangokubakhuthaza ukuba bachaze uloyiko lwabo malunga nokuya esikolweni. "

eng: "this is important, especially for subjects that learners find challenging," she adds.
xho: o k u k u b a l u l e k i l e , ingakumbi kwizifundo aba zifumana zinzima," wongeze watsho.

eng: family and friends can provide learners with emotional support, in the form of encouragement and constant reassurance, says tlhapane.
xho: usapho kunye nabahlobo banokunikezela ngenkxaso y a s e m p h e f u m l w e n i kubafundi, ngendlela yokubakhuthaza kunye nokuqinisekisa okunga guqukiyo, utshilo utlhapane "abafundi kufuneka beso loko bekhunjuzwa ukuba iinzame nokuzimisela kwabo ziqatshelwe kwaye zixatyisiwe, ngale ndlela kwa ndisa ukuzithemba kwabo.

eng: "how to reduce anxietytlhapane says there are various ways that parents and learners can reduce anxiety.
xho: "indlela yokunciphisa inkxalabo utlhapane uthi zininzi iindlela abathi abazali naba fundi banciphise ngazo inkxalabo.

eng: these include: ensure that there is a strict routine for studying, sleeping and socialising.
xho: ezi ziquka: ukuqinisekisa ukuba kukho inkqubo engqongqo yoku funda, eyokulala kunye neyokuzonwabisa.

eng: this will help learners meet their goals and deadlines, while helping them to feel in control of their studies.
xho: oku kuza kunceda abafundi ukuba bahlangabezane neenjongo zabo kunye nemihla ebekiweyo, ngelixa bencedwa ukuba bazive belawula izifundo zabo.

eng: learners must use all of the available resources provided at school and on educational programmes, in line with the curriculum, that are broadcast on television and radio.
xho: abafundi kufuneka base benzise zonke izibonelelo ezifumanekayo esikolweni nakwiinkqubo zemfundo, ngokuhambelana nekharityhulam, ezisasazwa kumabonakude nakunomathotholo.

eng: parents can assist by ensuring that learners are not overexposed to covid19 news, especially around death and conspiracy theories, as this may fuel their fears and lead to more psychological conditions.
xho: abazali bangancedisa ngokuqinisekisa ukuba abafundi abaziboni ka khulu iindaba zecovid19 , ingakumbi malunga noku sweleka kunye neengcingane zamayelenqe, njengoko oku kunoku bangela uloyiko lwabo kwaye kukhokelele kwii meko ezininzi zengqondo.

eng: learners should limit social media consumption, as it wastes study time and is a major distraction.
xho: abafundi kufuneka banci phise ukusebenzisa amajelo eendaba zoluntu, njengoko kuchitha ixesha lokufunda kwaye kusisiphazamiso esikhulu.

eng: the family can adapt their lifestyle by adding selfcare tasks, such as physical exercise and play.
xho: usapho lungakwazi uku ziqhelanisa nendlela yalo yokuphila ngokongeza imi sebenzi yokuzikhathalela, njengokuzilolonga kunye nokudlala.

eng: "if a learner loses a loved one, they may experience grief symptoms that resemble depression or anxiety.
xho: "ukuba umfundi uphu lukene nomntu amthandayo, banokuba neempawu zokubindeka ezifana nonxunguphalo okanye inkxalabo.

eng: "it is important that the school and the parents refer these learners for psychosocial support, which is provided by the department of basic education, or consult free resources or local clinics for a referral," says tlhapane.
xho: "kubalulekile ukuba isikolo kunye nabazali bathumele aba bafundi kwinkxaso ejongene neemfuno zengqondo nezentlalo, enikezelwa lisebe lemfundo esisiseko, okanye bacele ukuthunyelwa kwizi bonelelo zasimahla okanye kwiikliniki zasekuhlaleni," utshilo utlhapane.

eng: signs of distress parents should be alert and watch for various signs that may indicate that their child is in distress.
xho: iimpawu zembandezelo abazali kufuneka bahlale bephaphile kwaye bajonge iimpawu ezahlukeneyo ezi nokubonisa ukuba umntwana wabo usembandezelweni.

eng: these include: the child being withdrawn and isolating from others.
xho: ezi ziquka: ukuthula komntwana kunye nokuzikhetha kwabanye abantu.

eng: irregular eating and sleep patterns.
xho: ukutya kunye nokulala ngendlela ezingaqhele kanga.

eng: being overly emotional, such as constantly crying, irritable moods or losing their temper quickly.
xho: ukuba neemvakalelo ezigqithileyo, ezinjengo kuhlala ulila, ukucaphuka okanye ukuba nomsindo msinyane.

eng: struggling to concentrate.
xho: ukusokola ekugxileni.

eng: not completing tasks and homework.
xho: ukungayigqibi imisebenzi kunye nemisebenzi yesi kolo eyenzelwa ekhaya.

eng: behavioural problems, such as aggressiveness.
xho: iingxaki zokuziphatha, njengobundlongondlongo.

eng: making up excuses not to go to school.
xho: ukwenza izizathu zokungayi esikolweni.

eng: constantly on the phone or social media networks.
xho: ukubasemnxebeni rhoqo okanye kwiinethiwekhi zamajelo eendaba zoluntu.

eng: fails to complete other tasks of daily living.
xho: ukusilela ekugqibezeleni eminye imisebenzi yobomi yemihla ngemihla.

eng: for assistance, parents and learners can visit the department’s district offices.
xho: ukufumana uncedo, abazali kunye nabafundi banokutyelela iiofisi zezithili zesebe lemfundo.

eng: building a society free of state capture vukuzenzele unnamed the scheduled hearings of the judicial commission of inquiry into allegations of state capture, corruption and fraud in the public sector, including organs of state, recently ended, more than 1 000 days after the first witness testimony was heard.
xho: ukwakha isizwe esingena rhulumente obanjwe ngobhongwane vukuzenzele unnamed iindibano ebezihleli we zokunika ubu ngqina kwikhomishi ni yophando ngokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente ziqukunjelwe ku tshanje, emva kweentsu ku ezingaphezu kwe1 000 ingqina lokuqala lanikeza ngobungqina balo.

eng: while the commission’s chairperson, deputy chief justice raymond zondo has said it may be necessary for a few more witnesses to testify, the work of the commission is now one step closer to completion.
xho: nangona usihlalo wale khomishini, usekela wejaji eyintloko ura ymond zondo ethe kusenokubakho imfuneko yokuba amanye amangqina ambalwa anikeze ubungqina, umse benzi wekhomishini ngoku ukufutshane engqinibeni.

eng: this is a significant milestone that brings us ever closer to a reckoning with one of the most ruinous episodes in the history of our democracy.
xho: eli linyathelo elibaluleke kakhulu elisisondeza ngakumbi ekubaleni kwimbali yentando yesininzi yethu enye yezona ziganeko zonakalisayo.

eng: even before judge zondo submits his findings and recommendations to the president, we can all agree that the commission’s work has been invaluable.
xho: kwanangaphambi kokuba ujaji zondo angenise iziphumo neengcebiso zakhe kumongameli, singavuma sonke ukuba umsebenzi wekhomishini ubaluleke kakhulu.

eng: over the course of three years, we have heard testimony detailing alleged acts of corruption on a massive scale.
xho: kwisithuba seminyaka emithathu, sive ubungqina obuchaza ngezityholo zorhwaphilizo ezikwizinga eliphezulu.

eng: we have heard about actions that resulted in the theft of billions of rands of public money.
xho: sive ngezenzo ezikhokele ekubiweni kweebhiliyoni zeerandi zemali yoluntu.

eng: we have heard how many public institutions and stateowned companies were deliberately weakened.
xho: sive ukuba mangaphi amaziko karhulumente kunye neenkampani zikarhulumente ezenziwe buthathaka ngabom.

eng: this exposure of the nature, extent and depth of state capture did not take place behind closed doors, but was broadcast to the entire country.
xho: oku kuvezwa kwe ndlela, kobungakanani kunye nobunzulu bokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente akwenzekanga khusini, kodwa kwasasazwa kwilizwe lonke.

eng: by allowing all south africans to follow the commission’s proceedings, it has helped to instil public confidence in our democracy in the way it promotes openness and transparency.
xho: ngokuthi kuvunyelwe bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika ukuba balandele iingxelo zekhomishini, kuncede eku betheleleni ithemba kuluntu malunga nentando yesininzi yethu kwaye ikhuthaza ukungafihlwa kunye nokwenziwa kwezinto elubala.

eng: the country owes a debt of gratitude to all who were involved in the work of the commission; from those who investigated, researched and compiled a huge amount of information; to the many witnesses who testified and provided evidence; to the journalists who diligently reported on the proceedings; to the lawyers who helped present evidence.
xho: ilizwe lityala umbulelo omkhulu kubo bonke ababebandakanyeka kumsebenzi wekhomishini; ukusuka kwabo baqhube uphando, kwabo baphengulule baze bahlanganisa ulwazi olungaka; kumangqina amaninzi kangaka athe anikeza ngo bungqina; koonondaba abathe basasaza ngenkuthalo iingxelo zekhomishini; kumagqwetha ancedisileyo ekunikeni ubungqina.

eng: we also owe a debt of gratitude to the many individuals, some of whom remain unknown, whose actions led to the establishment of the commission in the first place.
xho: sikwatyala umbulelo omkhulu kubantu abaninzi, abanye babo abasaziwa, abo iintshukumo zabo zikhokelele ekumiselweni kwekhomishini kwasekuqaleni.

eng: these are the people who unearthed these alleged criminal acts, who resisted, who spoke out and who took up campaigns – both public and behind the scenes – to end state capture.
xho: aba ngabantu abathe bavumbulula ezi zityholo zolwaphulomthetho, abathe bachasa, bathetha phandle kwaye benza amaphulo — esidlangalaleni kunye nasekhusini — okupheliswa kokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulu mente.

eng: it is thanks to them that we now speak of state capture in the past tense.
xho: sibulela kubo, kuba ngoku xa sithetha ngoku banjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente sithetha ngento yexesha eladlulayo.

eng: state capture did not end of its own accord.
xho: ukubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente akuziphelelanga.

eng: it was brought to an end by the concerted actions of south africans from all walks of life, working in various areas to restore the values of our constitutional democracy.
xho: kuziswe esiphelweni zizenzo ezidi tyanelweyo zabemi bomzantsi afrika abavela kuzo zonke iinkalo zobomi, besebenza kwiindawo ezahlukeneyo ukubuyisa ixabiso lentando yesininzi yethu.

eng: and it is up to all of us to ensure that these practices are never allowed to happen again.
xho: kwaye kuxhomekeke kuthi sonke ukuqinisekisa ukuba ezi zinto asoze sizivumele ziphinde zenzeke.

eng: over the past three years, we have taken several important steps to tackle corruption and state capture.
xho: kule minyaka mithathu idlulileyo, sithathe amanya thelo abalulekileyo okulwa urhwaphilizo nokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulu mente.

eng: we have been painstakingly rebuilding bodies like the national prosecuting authority (npa), the south african police service, the south african revenue service and others.
xho: siye sazama sakha ngokutsha amaziko afana negunya lezotshutshiso lesizwe (inpa), inkonzo yamapolisa omzantsi afrika (isaps), inkonzo yerhafu yasemzantsi afrika (isars) kunye nezinye.

eng: we have set up new structures, like the investigating directorate in the npa to prosecute highlevel corruption and the special investigating unit (siu) special tribunal to recover stolen public funds.
xho: simisele imibutho emitsha, efana necandelo lophando kwinpa ukuze itshutshise abo benza urhwaphilizo kwizinga eliphezulu kunye nesigqeba esikhethekileyo sesiu soku fumana kwakhona iimali zoluntu ezibiweyo.

eng: we have improved our crimefighting capacity through the establishment of the fusion centre, which brings together various lawenforcement agencies to share information and coordinate the investigation and prosecution of crime.
xho: siwaphucule amandla ethu okulwa ulwaphulomthetho ngokuthi siseke iziko le ndibanisa (ifusion centre), elihlanganisa iiarhente ezahlukeneyo zabantu bomthetho ukuba babe lane ngolwazi kwaye balungelelanise uphando kunye nokutshutshiswa kolwaphulomthetho.

eng: we have changed the leadership at several strategic stateowned enterprises (soes), and begun the process of restoring them to financial and operational health.
xho: sibutshintshile ubunkokeli kumashishini karhulumente aphambili, saza saqalisa inkqubo yokuwabuyisela kwimmo entle yezemali neyokusebenza.

eng: we are working towards a new soe model that promotes greater transparency, accountability and sustainability.
xho: amashishini karhulumente ngoku asebenza ngemodeli entsha ekhuthaza ukungafihli, ukuthatha ixanduva lokuphendula kunye nezisa uzinzo.

eng: much of this work is ongoing.
xho: uninzi lwalo msebe nzi uyaqhubeka.

eng: there are areas where progress has been far slower than we would have hoped, and these are now receiving closer attention.
xho: kukho iindawo apho inkqubela phambili icotha kakhulu kunokuba sinqwena, kwaye ngoku ezi ndawo zifumana ingqwalaselo ethe chatha.

eng: the findings and recommendations of the commission will undoubtedly strengthen these efforts.
xho: iziphumo neengcebiso zekhomishini ngokunga thandabuzekiyo ziya kuzomeleza ezi nzame.

eng: we expect that the commission will identify some of the systemic weaknesses that allowed state capture to take place.
xho: silindele ukuba ikhomishini ichonge apho sibethakale khona okuthe kwenza ukuba kuvuleke ikroba lokuba kubanjwe urhulumente ngobhongwane.

eng: this will empower us to take further corrective measures.
xho: oku kuya kusixhobisa ngakumbi ukuba sithathe amanyathelo okulungisa aqatha.

eng: while we can say that the era of state capture is over, we have not defeated corruption.
xho: ngelixa sinokuthi ixesha lokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente liphelile, asikaloyisi urhwaphilizo.

eng: fraud and corruption remain pervasive and deeply entrenched in both the public and private sectors.
xho: ubuqhetseba kunye norhwaphilizo kusasazekile kwaye kungene nzulu kumaca ndelo karhulumente nawa bucala.

eng: although it may not be on the scale of state capture, such criminal activities cost our country greatly, weaken our institutions and deprive south africans of many basic needs.
xho: nangona kusenokungabikho kwizinga lokubanjwa ngobhongwane kukarhulumente, ezi zenzo zolwaphulomthetho zityabula kakhulu kwilizwe lethu, zenze namaziko ethu buthathaka kwaye zihluthe abemi bomzantsi afrika iimfuno ezininzi ezisisiseko.

eng: corruption is deeply immoral at the best of times, but takes on a greater depravity in the midst of a humanitarian crisis.
xho: urhwaphilizo kukuziphatha kakubi ngeyona ndlela, kodwa kuthatha umntu onenkohlakalo kakhulu ukuba arhwaphilize ngexesha lokuxakeka kwabantu.

eng: one speaks here of the despicable acts of corruption last year in the procurement of goods and services needed for our fight against the covid19 pandemic.
xho: ndithetha apha ngezenzo zenkohlakalo ezingaginyisi mathe ezenziwe kunyaka ophe lileyo xa bekuthengwa iimpahla kunye neenkonzo ebezidingeka kumlo wethu nobhubhane wecovid19.

eng: we acted swiftly to stop such corruption, to identify those responsible and to take action against them.
xho: sisebenze ngokukhawu leza kakhulu ukunqanda olo rhwaphilizo, saze sachonga abo bachaphaze lekayo kwaye sabatha thela amanyathelo.

eng: this is proof of our commitment to root out corruption.
xho: obu bubungqina bokuzinikela kwethu ekuncothuleni nengcambu urhwaphilizo.

eng: we tightened up treasury regulations, established the fusion centre and gave the siu a wideranging mandate to investigate all covid19related corruption allegations.
xho: siqinise imimiselo kanondyebo, saseka iziko lendibanisa (ifusion centre) kwaye sanika icandelo lokuphanda elikhethekileyo igunya elibanzi lokuphanda zonke izityholo zorhwaphilizo ezinxulumene necovid19.

eng: in a first for the country, we also published online the details of all covid19 procurement contracts across all public entities.
xho: okokuqala kwilizwe, sikwapapashe kwiintanethi iinkcukacha zazo zonke izi vumelwano ezisetyenziswe ngawo onke amaziko oluntu ngelixa kuthengwa izinto ezayamene necovid19.

eng: the damage done to our country by state capture is deep.
xho: umonakalo owenzeke kwilizwe lethu ngelixa urhulumente ebanjwe ngobhongwane unzulu.

eng: its effects will be felt for many years to come.
xho: kwaye iziphumo zawo siya kuziva nakwiminyaka emininzi ezayo.

eng: but, working together, we have started to put things right.
xho: kodwa siqalile uku lungisa izinto, sisebenza kunye.

eng: we have started to rebuild and restore.
xho: sesiqalile ukwakha kwakhona kwaye sibuyisela izinto esimweni.

eng: help prevent suicide allison cooper more people die as a result of suicide than hiv, malaria, breast cancer, war and homicide.
xho: masilwe ingxaki yokuzibulala kwabantu allison cooper baninzi abantu ababhubha ngokuzibulala kunabo babhubha ngenxa yehiv, ngesifo seengcongconi, ngo mhlaza wamabele, imfa zwe kunye nokubula lana.

eng: this is according to the world health organisation’s (who) latest statistics, which show that over 700 000 people die by suicide each year – that is one in every 100 deaths and approximately one person every 40 seconds.
xho: oku kuhambelana nee nkcukachamanani zakutshanje zombutho wezempilo wehlabathi (iwho), ezi bonisa ukuba bangaphezu kwama700 000 abantu aba bhubha ngokuzibulala unyaka nonyaka – ukutsho oko ngumntu omnye kwabali100 kwaye phantse umntu omnye kwimizu zwana engama40 kwababhubhileyo.

eng: "we cannot – and must not – ignore suicide," says dr tedros adhanom ghebreyesus, directorgeneral of the who.
xho: ugqr tedros adhanom ghe breyesus, umlawulijikelele wewho uthi: "asinakho kwaye akufuneki singa kuniki ngqalelo ukuzibulala.

eng: "each one is a tragedy.
xho: ""ukuzibulala oku kodwa nje kuyintlekele.

eng: our attention to suicide prevention is even more important now, after many months of living with the coronavirus disease pandemic, with many of the risk factors for suicide – job loss, financial stress and social isolation – still very much present," he adds.
xho: inqwalasela yethu ekuthinteleni ukuzi bulala ibaluleke ngakumbi ngoku, emva kweenyanga ezininzi siphila nobhubhane wesifo sentsholongwane yecorona, esize neengcipheko ezininzi zokuzibulala ukuphulukana nomsebenzi, uxinzelelo lwezezimali kunye nokuzikhetha eluntwini ezi sekhona nangoku," wongeze ngelitshoyo.

eng: world suicide prevention dayworld suicide prevention day was launched on 10 september 2003, by the international association for suicide prevention.
xho: usuku lwehlabathi loku thintela ukuzibulalausuku lokuthintela ukuzibulala lwehlabathi lwasungulwa ngomhla we10 kweyomsintsi 2003, ngumbutho wamazwe nga mazwe wokuthintela uku zibulala.

eng: it aims to prevent suicide and suicidal beha viour, alleviate its effects and provides a forum for academics, mental health professionals, crisis workers, volunteers and suicide survivors.
xho: lo mbutho ujolise ekuthinteleni ukuzibulala kunye neendlela zokuzibulala, kwaye ukwajolisa nasekunciphiseni iziphumo zokuzibulala, kananjalo ubonelela ngeqonga kwizi fundiswa, kwiingcali zempilo yengqondo, kubasebenzi bakaxakeka, kumavolontiya kunye nakwabo basinde ekuzibulaleni.

eng: according to the south african depression and anxiety group (sadag), there are 23 suicides and 230 serious suicide attempts recorded in south africa daily.
xho: ngokweqela labantu abano xinzelelo ngokomphefumlo lomzantsi afrika (isadag), umzantsi afrika ubhala abantu abangama23 yabo bazibuleleyo kunye nama230 yabantu abazama ukuzibulala mihla le.

eng: "suicide is still a very taboo topic in our society – no one wants to talk about it; no one knows how to talk about it and parents don’t want to talk to their children about it in case it ‘plants ideas’.
xho: "ukuzibulala kusengumba ongafuni kuphathwa luluntu akukho mntu ufuna ukuthetha ngako; akukho mntu waziyo indlela yokuthetha ngako kwaye abazali abafuni kuthetha nabantwana babo ngako hleze kanti 'ityale iimbono'.

eng: however, it is a very real issue, and can be seen by the increasing daily calls we receive," says cassey chambers, sadag’s operations director.
xho: nangona kunjalo, ukuzibulala kukhona kwaye kuyenzeka, oku kuno kubonwa ngenani leefowuni esizifumanayo elonyuka mihla le, utshilo ucassey chambers, ongumlawuli wezokusebenza wesadag.

eng: "if more people are aware of suicide and know how to get someone help before it’s too late, we can help reduce the suicide rate," she says.
xho: uthi, "ukuba abantu abaninzi bayaqonda ngokuzibulala kwaye bayayazi indlela yokufumanela umntu uncedo kusengethuba, oku kunonceda ukunciphisa izinga lokuzibulala,"iimpawu ezisisilumkiso ezinokubakho xa umntu ezakuzibulala:l ukuthetha ngokutshabala lisa ubomi bakhe, ngokufa okanye ngokuzibulala.

eng: possible suicide warning signs include: talking about ending one's life, dying or suicide.
xho: l umnqweno obalaseleyo wokufa okanye ukuzixa kekisa kakhulu ngokufa nokufa.

eng: giving away prized possessions.
xho: l ukuphisa ngezinto ezixabisekileyo.

eng: signs of depression, such as moodiness, hopelessness, withdrawal, difficul ty with appetite and sleep, and loss of interest in usual activities.
xho: l iimpawu zoxinzelelo, ezinje ngokungatyhileki, ukungabi nathemba, ukurhoxa, ukungabinamdla wokutya kunye nokulala nzima, nokuphelelwa ngumdla kwimisebenzi yesiqhelo.

eng: increased alcohol or drug use.
xho: lukwanda kokusela utywala okanye ukusebenzisa iziyobisi.

eng: hinting about not being around in the future or saying goodbye.
xho: l ukuthetha ngokungabikho kwixesha elizayo okanye avalelise.

eng: drastic behaviour changes.
xho: lutshintsho olukhulu kwindlela yokuziphatha.

eng: sa salutes whistleblowers vukuzenzele unnamed over the course of the three years, since the commission of inquiry into state capture started its work, we have heard of the lengths to which the perpetrators of corrupt acts have gone to conceal their misdeeds.
xho: mzantsi afrika wothulela umnqwazi abavezi bobubi vukuzenzele unnamed kwisithuba semi nyaka emithathu ukusukela oko ikomishini yophando lokubanjwa ngobho ngwane kukarhulu mente ithe yaqala umse benzi wayo, sivile ngobunzulu abenzi bobubi bezenzo zorhwa philizo abathe bafihla ngayo izenzo zabo ezinga lunganga.

eng: it has been an extremely complex undertaking to unravel the networks of influence that enabled corruption.
xho: ibiyinto enzima kakhulu ukwazisa uthungelwano lwempembelelo olwenza urhwaphilizo.

eng: among other things, vast webs of front companies were established to move funds around and disguise payments made to politicallyconnected individuals.
xho: phakathi kwe zinye izinto, uthungelwano olukhulu lweenkampani eziphambili zasekwa ukuze zihambise imali ngokujikelezayo kwaye zifihle iintlawulo ezenziwe kubantu abanxulumene nezopo litiko.

eng: the same patterns have been seen in a number of investigations into corruption being undertaken by the special investigating unit (siu) the directorate for priority crime investigation, the national prosecuting authority's (npa) investigating directorate and others.
xho: ezi ndlela zifanayo zibonwe kuphando oluninzi lorhwaphilizo olwenziwa licandelo lophando olukhethekileyo (isiu), icandelo lophando lolwaphulomthetho oluphambili, icandelo lophando legunyabantu lezotshutshiso kunye namanye.

eng: as these investigations progressed and the net began to close on implicated individuals, we have seen witnesses being threatened, their families intimidated, being forced into hiding, and even killed.
xho: njengokuba olu phando luqhubeka kwaye nomnatha uqala ukuvaleka kubantu abachaphazelekayo, siye sabona amangqina egrogriswa, iintsapho zawo zisoyikiswa, zinyanzelwa ukuba zizimele, zide zibu lawe.

eng: the murder of babita deokaran, a senior finance official in the gauteng health department, is a stark reminder of the high stakes involved in our collective quest to remove this cancer from our society.
xho: ukubulawa kukababita deokaran, igosa eliphezulu lezemali kwisebe lezempilo egauteng, sisikhumbuzo esicace kakhulu somngcipheko ophezulu obandakanyekayo kwiphulo lethu elihlangeneyo lokususa lomkhwa ku luntu lwethu.

eng: while we do not yet know the motive for her murder, she was a key witness in a siu investigation into the procurement of personal protective equipment in the department.
xho: ngelixa singekasazi isizathu sokubulawa kwakhe, wayelingqina eliphambili kuphando lwesiu oluma lunga nokuthengwa kwe zixhobo zokuzikhusela kwisebe.

eng: the saps and the private security teams who apprehended seven suspects recently are to be commended for their work.
xho: inkonzo yamapolisa omzantsi afrika (isaps) kunye namaqela okhuseleko abucala abambe abarha nelwa abasixhenxe kutshanje kufuneka banconywe ngomsebenzi wabo.

eng: the docket has been transferred to the hawks, and the investigation will yield further information on why ms deokaran was murdered.
xho: uxwebhu lwamatyala ludluliselwe kumahawks, kwaye uphando luza ku nikezela ngezinye iinkcukacha ezimalunga nokuba kutheni unks deoka ran wabulawa.

eng: regardless of the circumstances behind this tragedy, ms deokaran was a hero and a patriot.
xho: nokuba zithini iimeko ezibangelwe yile ntlekele, unks deokaran wayeli gokra kunye nomthandi welizwe lakhe.

eng: as are the legions of whistleblowers who, at great risk to themselves, help to unearth instances of misdeeds, maladministration, cronyism and theft.
xho: njengokuba isininzi sabavezi bobubi abathi bazibeke emngci phekweni omkhulu, bancede ukufumana izenzo ezingalunganga, ulawulo olugwenxa, ukuqesha ngokokuzalana kunye nobusela.

eng: without their brave and principled interventions, we would be unable to unmask those committing corruption.
xho: ngaphandle kongenelelo lwabo olukhaliphileyo nolunokuziphatha ngoku fanelekileyo, besingasokuze sikwazi ukuveza abo benza urhwaphilizo.

eng: though much focus in recent times has been on whistleblowers in the public sector, we also owe a debt of gratitude to those in the private sector whose actions receive less attention, but are equally important.
xho: nangona kumaxesha akutshanje kugxilwe kakhulu kubavezi bobubi kwicandelo likarhulumente, sikwane tyala lokubulela abo ba kumacandelo abucala abo izenzo zabo zingathathelwanga ngqalelo, kodwa babalulekile ngokulinganayo.

eng: whistleblowers are important guardians of our democracy.
xho: abavezi bobubi ngabagcini ababalulekileyo bentando yesininzi yethu.

eng: they raise the alarm against unethical acts and practices in government and organisations.
xho: bahlaba umkhosi ngokuchasene nezenzo nangeendlela zokuziphatha ezingekho mthethweni kurhulu mente nakwimibutho.

eng: they speak out in good faith and with a reasonable expectation not only that action will be taken on their disclosures, but that they will be protected and not suffer victimisation or prejudice.
xho: bathetha phandle ngoku thembekileyo nango lindeleko olunengqiqo kungekuko kuphela ukuba inyathelo liza kuthathwa ekuvezeni kwabo, kodwa baza kukhuselwa kwaye bangabinakuphathwa gadalala okanye bacalucalulwe.

eng: in south africa there is extensive legislative protection for whistleblowers, including through the protected disclosures act, labour relations act, companies act, protection against harassment act, and the constitution itself.
xho: emzantsi afrika kukho ukhuseleko olubanzi lo mthetho lwabavezi bobubi, kuquka indlela yomthetho wezibhengezo ezikhuselweyo, umthetho wezobudle lwane emsebenzini, umthetho weenkampani, ukhuseleko ngokuchasene nomthetho wokuxhatsha zwa, kunye nomgaqosiseko ngokwawo.

eng: in addition, the department of justice and correctional services, working with other lawenforcement agencies, administers the office of witness protection to provide support to vulnerable and intimidated witnesses in any judicial proceedings.
xho: ukongeza, isebe lezobulungisa neenkonzo zoluleko, lisebenzisana nezinye iiarhente zogcinomthetho, lilawula iofisi yokhuseleko lwamangqina ukuba linike inkxaso kumangqina asemngciphekweni noyikiswayo nakweyiphi na inkqubo yezomthetho.

eng: entering witness protection is voluntary, and neither the saps nor the npa can compel a witness to do so.
xho: ukungena kukhuseleko lwamangqina kwenziwa ngokuzithandela, kwaye akukho namnye kwisaps okanye inpa abanokunya nzela ingqina ukuba lenze oko.

eng: should a witness receive threats to their life or feel unsafe, they have to inform investigators and apply for admission to the programme.
xho: ukuba ingqina lifumana izigrogriso ebomini balo okanye liziva lingakhuselekanga, kufuneka lazise abaphandi kwaye lifake isicelo sokungeniswa kule nkqubo.

eng: this successful programme has played a key role in securing successful prosecutions since its inception, particularly with regards to organised crime.
xho: le nkqubo inempumelelo idlale indima ebalulekileyo ekuqinisekiseni ukutshutshiswa okunempumelelo ukusukela oko yaqalayo, ingakumbi ngokubheki selele kulwaphulomthetho olulungelelanisiweyo.

eng: it is clear that as the fight against corruption gathers momentum, we need to urgently review our current approach not only to witness protection, but also to the broader protection of whistleblowers.
xho: kucacile ukuba njengo kuba idabi lokulwa no rhwaphilizo lifumana umfutho, kufuneka siyi qwalasele ngokungxa misekileyo indlela yethu yangoku kungekuphela nje ukhuseleko lwama ngqina, kodwa ibelukhu seleko olubanzi lwabavezi bobubi kananjalo.

eng: while numerous systems are in place to enable whistleblowers to report anonymously, we need to tighten up existing systems and provide greater support to those who publicly come forward with information.
xho: ngelixa iinkqubo ezininzi zisekhona ukwenza ukuba abavezi bobubi benze ingxelo ngokufihlakeleyo, kufuneka siqinise iinkqubo esele zikho kwaye sinikezele ngenkxaso enkulu kwabo beza phambili esidlangalaleni kunye neenkcukacha.

eng: as society, we need to identify where existing laws and policies are inadequate in protecting the livelihoods, reputations and safety of whistleblowers – and work together to address these.
xho: njengoluntu, kufuneka sichonge apho imithetho ekhoyo kunye nemigaqonkqubo zingonelanga ekukhuseleni iindlela zokuziphilisa, udumo kunye nokukhuseleka kwabavezi bobubi kwaye sisebenzisane ekusombululeni ezi zinto.

eng: the intent of the criminals who target whistleblowers is not only to silence particular individuals – it is also to send a message to other potential whistleblowers.
xho: iinjongo zabaphulimthetho abajolise kubavezi bobubi ayikokuvala umlomo nje abantu abathile ikwaku kuthumela umyalezo kwabanye abantu abazakuba ngabavezi bobubi.

eng: day by day, brave south africans like babita deokaran are standing firm that they will not be party to corruption and they are prepared to bear witness against it.
xho: imihla ngemihla, abemmi bo mzantsi afrika abakhaliphileyo abanjengo babita deokaran abagungqi kwinto yokuba abazukuba yinxa lenye yorhwaphilizo kwaye bakulungele ukunikezela ngobungqina ngokuchasene nalo.

eng: as the south african people, we salute her and all the whistleblowers in the public and private sectors who are exposing corruption to the harshest of glares.
xho: njengabantu basemzantsi afrika simothulela umnqwa zi kunye nabo bonke aba vezi bobubi kumacandelo karhulumente nawabu cala abaveza urhwaphilizo ebaleni.

eng: they are doing so without expectation of acknowledgement or reward.
xho: benza oko ngaphandle kokulindela ukunconywa okanye umvuzo.

eng: theirs is the highest form of public service.
xho: okwabo nje lolona hlobo luphezulu lwenkonzo yoluntu.

eng: we cannot let them down.
xho: asinakho ukubaphoxa.

eng: spot childhood cancer warning signs allison cooper childhood cancer is on the rise globally, with an esti mated one in 408 children worldwide diagnosed with cancer before the age of 15. according to taryn seegers, the communications coordinator at the childhood cancer foundation of south africa (choc), it is believed that two thirds of children with cancer do not receive treatment and often those who do are already in the late stages of the disease.
xho: qaphela iimpawu zezilumkiso zomhlaza wabantwana allison cooper inyanga yokwazisa ngomhlaza wabantwana, eyenzeka rhoqo kweyomsintsi, iveza ukwaziwa kwemihlaza yabantwana emininzi.

eng: since 2011, choc has been working with the department of health and traditional healers to provide health professionals, healthcare workers, traditional healers and communities with knowledge of childhood cancer.
xho: umhlaza waba ntwana unyuka kwihlabathi jike lele, ekuqikelelwa uku ba kwisinye sabantwana abangama408 kwihlabathi lonke sifunyaniswe sino mhlaza ngaphambi kwe minyaka eli15.

eng: "these individuals are taught the siluan early warning signs and learn how to demystify myths and stigma in communities," says seegers.
xho: ngokukataryn seegers, umququzeleli wezonxibelelwano kumbutho womhlaza wabantwana wasemzantsi afrika (ichoc), kukholelwa ukuba isibini kwisithathu sabantwana abanomhlaza abalufumani unyango kwaye amaxesha amaninzi abobalufumanayo sele bekwinqanaba lokugqibela lesi sifo.

eng: the siluan early warning signs are: seek: medical help for early, persistent symptoms.
xho: ukusukela ngowama2011, ichoc ibisebenza nesebe lezempilo kunye namaxhwele ukunikezela iingcali zempilo, abasebenzi bezempilo, amaxhwele kunye noluntu ngolwazi lomhlaza wabantwana.

eng: eye: white spot in the eye, new squint, new blindness, bulging eyeball.
xho: "aba bantu bafundiswe ngeempawu zezilumkiso zangethuba zesiluan kwaye bafunda ngendlela yokwenza lula ukuqonda uluvo olungachanekanga kunye noku bekwa amabala kwiindawo zabahlali," utshilo useegers.

eng: lump: abdomen and pelvis, head and neck, limbs, testes and glands.
xho: iliso: ibala elimhlophe esweni, ukufifithekisa, ukungaboni, ikhozo lwe liso elithe phuhlu.

eng: unexplained: prolonged fever over two weeks, weight loss, pallor, fatigue, easy bruising or bleeding.
xho: iqhuma: isisu kunye nesinqe, intloko kunye nentamo, amalungu omzimba, amatyhalarha kunye namadlala.

eng: aching: bones, joints, back and easy fractures.
xho: okungachazekiyo: umkhu hlane wexesha elide elingaphezulu kweeveki ezimbini, ukuncipha, imbonakalo exwebileyo engenampilo, ukudinwa, ukugruzuka lula okanye ukopha.

eng: neurological signs: change or deterioration in walk, balance or speech, regression of milestones, headache for more than a week with or without vomiting and an enlarged head.
xho: ukuqaqamba: amathambo, amalungu omzimba, umqolo kunye nokwaphuka lula.

eng: childhood cancerschildhood cancers are different from cancers affecting adults.
xho: imihlaza yabantwanaimihlaza yabantwana yahlukile kwimihlaza echaphazela abantu abadala.

eng: they tend to occur in the organs of the body, look different under the microscope and respond more favourably to treatment, says seegers.
xho: zisoloko zisenzeka kumalungu omzimba, zikhange leka ngokwahlukileyo phantsi kwesibonakhulu kwaye zisabela kakuhle kunyango, utshilo useegers.

eng: "cure rates for most childhood cancers are much higher than those for most adult cancers.
xho: "amazinga onyango kuninzi lwemihlaza yabantwana aphakame kakhulu kunalawo omhlaza omninzi wabantu abadala.

eng: today, in developing countries, the majority of childhood cancers can be treated very effectively, and between 50% to 60% can be cured.
xho: namhlanje, kumazwe asakhasayo, uninzi lwemihlaza yabantwana lunokunyangwa ngokuse benzayo kakhulu, kwaye phakathi kwe50% ukuya kwi60% inokunyangwa.

eng: in highincome countries, the survival rate can be between 85% to 90%.
xho: kumazwe anengeniso ephezulu, izinga lokusinda linokubaphakathi kwe85% ukuya kwi90%.

eng: brics key to sa's growth vukuzenzele unnamed a year before the first democratic elections, president nelson mandela wrote an article in foreign policy magazine on the new south africa’s future foreign policy.
xho: ibrics yinto ebaluleke kakhulu ekukhuleni komzantsi afrika vukuzenzele unnamed kunyaka ongapha mbi konyulo loku qala lwentando ye sininzi, umongameli ne lson mandela wabhala inqa ku kwiphephancwadi leforeign policy malunga nomgaqonkqubo weza ngaphandle omtsha wo mzantsi afrika.

eng: reflecting on the shifts in global alliances brought about by the end of the cold war, he wrote that countries would have to "recast their nets" if they were to reap any benefit from international affairs.
xho: ecinga ngotshintsho kuma nyano lwehlabathi oluziswe kukuphela kwecold war , wabhala ukuba amazwe kwakuza kufuneka ukuba "ayiphose kwakhona imi natha yayo" ukuba ayeza kuvuna iinzuzo kwimiba yamazwe ngamazwe.

eng: since the tectonic shift of 1994 when we made a decisive break with not just apartheid but the international relations outlook of its architects, south africa’s foreign policy continues to be characterised by this "recasting the net".
xho: oko kwabakho utshintso olumandla luka1994 nge thuba sithabatha isigqibo sokwahlukana hayi nocalu calulo nje kuphela kodwa nendlela ababubona ngayo ubudlelwane namazwe ngamazwe abayili balo, umgaqonkqubo wamazwe ngamazwe womzantsi afrika uqhubeka nokuphawulwa koku "kuphosa umnatha kwakhona".

eng: our foreign policy priorities are regional political and economic integration, pursing african development, multilateral engagement and the promotion of democracy, peace and human rights.
xho: umgaqonkqubo wethu wamazwe ngamazwe ubeka phambili umanyaniso lopoli tiko noqoqosho lwengingqi, ukuzingela uphuhliso lweafrika, ukuzibandakanya kwamazwe amaninzi kunye nokuphakanyiswa kwenta ndo yesininzi, uxolo nama lungelo oluntu.

eng: to this end, we have forged strategic alliances with both the countries of the global south and mutually beneficial cooperation with the countries of the north.
xho: ukuza kuthi ga ngoku, sibumbe umanyano lobuchule namazwe ehlabathi asezantsi kunye nentsebenziswano ezuzisa amacala omabini namazwe asemantla.

eng: joining the brics group of countries in 2010 was a milestone in our quest to advance our own national development priorities by forging stronger ties with the important emerging economies of brazil, russia, india and china.
xho: ukuzibandakanya neqela lamazwe ebrics ngo2010 kwaba yimbalasane kwi phulo lethu lokuqhuba ezethu izinto ezihamba phambili ekuphuhliseni isizwe sethu ngokwenza ubumbano olo melele nangakumbi kunye namazwe abalulekileyo ano qoqosho osele lubukukhula asebrazil, erussia, eindia nasechina.

eng: put into context, brics countries comprise roughly 41% of the world’s population and account for around 24% of global gdp and some 16% of global trade.
xho: xa ejongwa onke ngoku pheleleyo, amazwe ebrics enza malunga neepesenti ezingama41 zoluntu lwehla bathi kwaye anikela malunga neepesenti ezingama24 kwimveliso yelizwe yonyaka kunye neepesenti ezili16 ku rhwebo lwehlabathi.

eng: we have reaped the benefits of membership of this important bloc, most notably in the area of economic cooperation.
xho: sivune iinzuzo zobulungu beli qela lamazwe, ngokukodwa kwintsebenziswano yezoqo qosho.

eng: bilateral trade has grown, particularly with china and india, with commodity exports and manufactured goods imports featuring strongly.
xho: urhwebo lwamazwe ama bini lukhulile, ingakumbi kunye nechina neindia, apho urhwebo lwempahla eya ngaphandle nempahla eyenziweyo ilolona luhamba phambili.
