eng: this suggests that some men do not understand that sexual activity without explicit consent is a crime.
xho: oku kuphakamisa ukuba amanye amadoda akaqondi ukuba ukwabelana ngesondo ngaphandle kwemvume ecacileyo lulwaphulomthetho.

eng: men must respect their wives and girlfriends and understand that being in an intimate partner relationship is never a justification for domestic violence.
xho: amadoda kufuneka ahloniphe abafazi bawo kunye namantombazana athandana nawo kwaye aqonde okokuba ukuba kubudlelwane bokuthandana ayisosizathu sokuba kwenzeke ubundlobongela basekhaya.

eng: if each man gathers two men and the three pledge to never rape a woman, never lay a hand on a woman and hold each other accountable to this pledge, we can start to seriously tackle gbv in our country.
xho: ukuba indoda nganye iqokelela amadoda amabini kwaye bobathathu benze isibhambathiso sokuba abasoze badlwengule owasetyhini, abasoze babeke isandla kowasetyhini kwaye babambane kwaye indoda nganye ibenoxanduva lokuphendula ngesi sibhambathiso, singaqalisa ngokuzimiseleyo ukulwa negbv kwilizwe lethu.

eng: it is not enough to intervene only once perpetrators have entered the criminal justice system.
xho: akwanelanga ukungenelela kuphela xa abenzi bobubi bengenile kwinkqubo yobulungisa yolwaphulomthetho.

eng: we have to prevent gbv before it happens.
xho: kufuneka sithintele igbv phambi kokuba yenzeke.

eng: i call on all south african men, young and old, city dwellers and rural dwellers, modernists and traditionalists, married and unmarried, to be part of the prevention efforts that are sorely needed in homes and in our communities.
xho: ndimemelela onke amadoda omzantsi afrika, ulutsha kunye namadoda amadala, abahlali basezidolophini kunye nabahlali basezilalini, kubantu abakholelwa kwiinkqubo zala maxesha kunye nabo basagcine izithethe, abatshatileyo nabangatshatanga, ukuba babe yinxalenye yeenzame zothintelo ezifuneka ngamandla emakhayeni nakwiindawo esihlala kuzo.

eng: by refusing to condone violence against women and children, by not being party to it yourself and by reporting such acts, you are setting an example to your fellow men, especially to young men and boys.
xho: ngokwala ukuvumela ubundlobongela obujo liswe kwabasetyhini kunye nabantwana, ngokungabandakanyeki kubo wena buqu kwaye ngokuxela izenzo ezinjalo, umisela umzekelo kwamanye amadoda ngokubanzi, ingakumbi kubafana namakhwenkwe.

eng: work together to strengthen democracy vukuzenzele unnamed as south africa entered the new year, we were confronted by two pro found events that remind ed us, in different ways, of what brings us together as a people.
xho: masisebenzisane ukomeleza ulawulo lwentando yesininzi vukuzenzele unnamed njengokuba umzantsi afrika ungena kunyaka omtsha, ujongene neziganeko ezibini ezinzulu ezisikhumbuza ngeendlela ezahlukeneyo, into esidibanisayo.

eng: on the first day of 2022, the nation gathered in spirit to bid farewell to arch bishop desmond tutu at st george’s cathedral in cape town.
xho: ngosuku lokuqala luka2022, isizwe sahlangana ukuthi ndlelantle kubhishophu omkhulu udesmond tutu est george’s cathedral, eka pa. ibilixesha elibuhlungu kakhulu sikhumbula ubomi kunye negalelo leqabane elithandekayo, nowaye sisazela, ngeendlela ezininzi, zokuziphatha sisisizwe.

eng: it was a moment of great sadness as we recalled the life and contribution of a beloved compatriot who was, in many ways, the moral conscience of our nation.
xho: kwaxeshanye, umngcwabo wakhe ibungumbhiyozo wezinto ebezimele.

eng: at the same time, his funeral was a celebration of the values he stood for.
xho: ibingumbhiyozo womanyano kunye nehlobo abantu bethu abohlukene ngalo, kwaye ibisisikhumbuzo sokuzincama okwenziwa ngabantu ukufezekisa le ntando yesininzi yethu.

eng: it was a celebration of the great unity and diversity of our people, and a reminder of the sacrifices made by so many to achieve our democracy.
xho: ngosuku lwesibini luka2022, ilizwe labukela lunxunguphele umlilo omkhulu owawutshisa ipalamente yethu, kumgama nje olikhulu leemitha ukusuka apho sasidibanele khona kusuku olungaphambili sinika imbeko yethu yokugqibela kubhishophu omkhulu ututu.

eng: we are relieved that there was no loss of life and that noone was injured in the fire.
xho: sixolile ke noko kuba akukho mntu wabhubhayo kwaye akukho mntu wonzakalayo kulo mlilo.

eng: we are extremely gra teful to the firefighters who battled the blaze and finally extinguished it.
xho: sibulela kakhulu kubacimimlilo abathe balwa lo mlilo baze bawucima ekugqibeleni.

eng: the investigations into the cause of the fire are now underway.
xho: uphando ngonobangela walo mlilo luyaqhuba.

eng: we need to ensure that these investigations are thorough and concluded without delay.
xho: kufuneka siqinisekise ukuba olu phando lwenziwa ngokugqibeleleyo kwaye luyaqukunjelwa ngaphandle kolibaziseko.

eng: the country needs to know what happened.
xho: ilizwe kufuneka lazile ukuba kwenzeke ntoni.

eng: arrangements are being made to ensure that the work of parliament can continue even if the buildings cannot be used.
xho: amalungiselelo enziwe ukuqinisekisa ukuba imisebenzi yepalamente iyaqhuba nokuba izakhiwo azinakusetyenziswa.

eng: it is vital that parliament continues to consider and pass laws that will transform society and continues to provide oversight and ensure accountability as government works to implement the mandate it received from the people.
xho: kubalulekile ukuba ipalamente iqhubeke ithathe ingqalelo kwaye ipasise imithetho eza kuguqula uluntu kwaye iqhubeke ukubeka iliso nokuqinisekisa uxanduva njengoko urhulumente esebenzela ukuphumeza isigunyaziso asifumene ebantwini.

eng: apart from the close proximity of st george’s cathedral and parliament, what connects these two events is that each reminds us of what brings us together as south africans: our democracy.
xho: ngaphandle kokuba kufutshane kwest george’s cathedral kunye nepalamente, into edibanisa le misitho mibini kukuba umsitho ngamnye usikhumbuza ngeyonanto isidibanisayo njengabemi bomzantsi afrika: intando yesininzi yethu.

eng: we mourn desmond tutu because he was the spiritual father of our democracy.
xho: simzilele udesmond tutu kuba ebengutata osibonisa indlela malunga nentando yesininzi yethu.

eng: we despair at the devas tation of our parliamentary buildings because they are the seat of our democracy.
xho: sikhathazekile ngokonakala kwezakhiwo zethu zasepalamente kuba zizisihlalo sentando yesininzi yethu.

eng: they are the place where our new democratic constitution was adopted just over 25 years ago, and where hundreds of trans formative laws have been passed.
xho: ziyindawo apho umgaqosiseko wethu omtsha wentando yesininzi wamkelwa khona kwisithuba nje seminyaka engama25 eyadlulayo, nalapho amakhulukhulu emithetho yethu yenguqu iye yapasiswa khona.

eng: we may not always recognise it, but the fire at parliament demonstrated how strongly south africans feel about their democracy.
xho: sisenongasoloko siyiqaphela loo nto, kodwa umlilo wasepalamente ubonise indlela abaziva ngayo abemi bomzantsi afrika ngentando yesininzi yabo.

eng: it is a reminder also of how important it is that we work to strengthen and defend that democracy.
xho: kukwasisikhumbuzo sokuba kubaluleke kangakanani na ukuba sisebenzele ukomeleza nokukhusela le ntando yesininzi.

eng: while the parliamentary buildings have been damaged beyond use, the institution of parliament continues its work in the service of the people.
xho: ngelixa izakhiwo zepalamente zonakaliswe ngapha kweqondo lokusebenziseka kwakhona, iziko lepalamente liyaqhuba nomsebenzi walowokunceda abantu.

eng: this is an important reminder that our democratic institutions are not defined by the buildings that house them, but by the work they do and by the confidence that the people have in them.
xho: esi sisikhumbuzo esibalulekileyo sokuba amaziko ethu entando yesininzi awazozakhiwo, kodwa angumsebenzi owenziwayo kunye nethemba abantu abanalo ngakuwo.

eng: this is true of all the institutions of our democracy.
xho: oku kuyinyaniso kuwo onke amaziko ethu entando yesininzi.

eng: just as the fire in parliament was finally being extinguished, acting chief justice raymond zondo submitted the first part of the report of the commission of inquiry into state capture.
xho: kanye xa ucinywa umlilo epalamente, ibambela lejaji eyintloko uraymondzondo ungeniseinxalenye yokuqala yengxelo yekomishini yophando ngokuthathwa kombuso.

eng: this part of the report details how several public institutions were infiltrated, looted and severely damaged.
xho: le nxalenye yengxelo inika iinkcukacha ngendlela amaziko oluntu amaninzi athe angenwa ngayo, aphangwa kwaye onakaliswa kakhulu.

eng: these include stateowned enterprises like south african airways, the government communication and information system and the south african revenue service.
xho: oku kuquka amashishini karhulumente afana neziko lomoya lomzantsi afrika, inkqubo yonxibelelwano lolwazi lukarhulumente kunye nenkonzo yerhafu yomzantsi afrika.

eng: this part of the report paints a deeply disturbing picture of how key instituti ons of our democracy were compromised and undermined with criminal intent.
xho: le nxalenye yale ngxelo izoba umfanekiso okhathazayo kakhulu, wendlela apho amaziko abalulekileyo entando yesininzi athi afakwa engozini kwaye ajongelwa phantsi ngenjongo yolwaphulomthetho.

eng: not only were significant amounts of money stolen, but these institutions were not able to properly fulfil the functions for which they were established.
xho: akubiwanga nje izixa zemali kuphela, kodwa la maziko awakwazanga kuzalisekisa ngokufanelekileyo imisebenzi ayemiselwe yona.

eng: the findings and recommendations of the zondo commission will help the country to rebuild these institutions and to hold those responsible to account.
xho: iziphumo kunye nezindululo zekomishini kazondo ziza kunceda ilizwe ukuba liwakhe ngokutsha la maziko kwaye libambe abo banoxanduva lokuphendula.

eng: we must ensure that we use them to safeguard these institutions into the future so that they may never be captured again.
xho: kufuneka siqinisekise ukuba siyazisebenzisa ukuze sikhusele la maziko nakwixesha elizayo angaphinde athinjwe.

eng: we must safeguard against any and all efforts to diminish our hardwon democracy – whether these efforts take the form of corruption in stateowned enterprises, the subversion of our law enforcement agencies, the sabotage of our economic infrastructure, or attacks on the independence and integrity of our judiciary.
xho: kufuneka sizikhusele kuzo zonke iinzame zokuthothisa intando yesininzi yethu esiyizuze nzima – nokuba ezi nzame zikwihlobo lorhwaphilizo kumashishini karhulumente, ukubhukuqa iiarhente zethu zogcinomthetho, ukonakaliswa kweziseko ezingundoqo zoqoqosho, okanye ukuhlaselwa kwenkululeko kunye nobulungisa beenkundla zethu zamatyala.

eng: we need to protect our constitution, our democratic state and the electoral process from anyone who wants to weaken our democracy and deny the south african people of their hardwon freedom.
xho: kufuneka sikhusele umgaqosiseko wethu, urhulumente wethu wentando yesininzi kunye nenkqubo yonyulo kuye nabani na ofuna ukwenza buthathaka intando yesininzi yethu; avimbe abantu bomzantsi afrika inkululeko yabo abayizuze nzima.

eng: free training and services for businesses vukuzenzele unnamed three government entities are firmly focused on enabling the ease of doing business in south africa to grow the economy.
xho: uqeqesho lwasimahla kunye neenkonzo ezenzelwe amashishini kgatiso tlhakole amaqumrhu amathathu karhulumente agxile ekuncediseni ukuba kube lula ukwenza ushishino emzantsi afrika ukuze kukhule uqoqosho.

eng: a recent vuktalks webinar, hosted by govern ment communication and information system, was held to raise awareness of the mandate, policies and services provided by the companies and intellectual property commission (cipc), companies tribunal (ct) and the broadbased black economic empowerment (bbbee) commission.
xho: iintetho ngeintanethi zakutshanje zevuk talks , ebezibanjwe yinkqubo yonxibelelwano lolwazi lukarhulumente, zabanjelwa ukwazisa ngesigunyaziso, imigaqonkqubo kunye neenkonzo ezinikezwa yikomishini yokubhalisa iinkampani nobugcisa bengqondo (icipc), inkundla yeenkampani (ict) kunye nekhomishini yokuxhotyiswa kwabamnyama ngokubanzi kwezoqoqosho (ibbbee).

eng: these are all entities of the department of trade, indus try and competition.
xho: onke la ngamaqumrhu esebe lezorhwebo, ushishino nokhuphiswano.

eng: according to ofentse shakung, the cipc’s manager of innovation and collaboration and director of elearning, the cipc has various functions, including the registration of companies, cooperatives and intellectual property rights (trademarks, patents, designs and copyright).
xho: ngokutshiwo nguofentse shakung, umphathi wecipc wokusungulwa kwezinto ezintsha kunye nentsebenziswano kunye nomlawuli weelearning, icipc inemisebenzi eyahlukeneyo, equka ukubhaliswa kweenkampani, umanyano lwamashishini kunye namalungelo obunini bempahla (iimpawu zorhwebo, amalungelo awodwa omenzi wempahla, uyilo kunye nelungelo lokushicilela).

eng: the cipc developed its bizportal platform to offer online company registration and related services to simplify the process of register ing a business and adhering to requirements.
xho: icipc iphuhlise iqonga layo lebizportal ukuze kubhaliswe iinkampa ni kunye neenkonzo zayo kwiintanethi, oku kukwenza lula inkqubo yokubhalisa ishishini kunye nokuthobelaizinto ezifunwayo.

eng: bizportal offers those wanting to start a business a onestop platform to register a company, register for tax, register a domain name, apply for a bbbee certificate, register for the compensation fund and unemployment insurance fund, and open a business bank account.
xho: ibizportal inika abo bafuna ukuqalisa ishishini iqonga elipheleleyo lokubhalisa inkampani, ukubhali sela irhafu, ukubhalisa igama, ukufaka isicelo sesatifikethi sebbbee, ukubhalisa kwingxowamali yembuyekezo kunye nengxowamali yeinshurensi yokungasebenzi, kunye nokuvula iakhawunti yebhanki yeshishini.

eng: "it’s a paperless process and the company will be registered within 24 hours of submission.
xho: "yinkqubo engasebenzisi maphepha kwaye inkampani iya kubhaliswa kwiiyure ezingama24 ingenisiwe.

eng: we have also added google business services, which enables companies to host a business profile and static company website on google for free," said shakung.
xho: sikwangeze iinkonzo zeshishini likagoogle, ezenza ukuba iinkampani zifumane iprofayile yeshishini kunye newebhusayithi yenkampani kugoogle simahla," utshilo ushakung.

eng: to make use of these services, visit www.
xho: ukusebenzisa ezi nkonzo, yiya kuwww.

eng: bizportal.
xho: bizportal.

eng: gov.
xho: gov.

eng: za and click on ‘register’ at the top of the page.
xho: za ucofe ku'register' ophezulu kwephepha elo.

eng: the portal is easy to navigate and offers stepbystep information on how to register a business.
xho: iportal ilula ukuyiphendlaphendla kwaye ichaza ngendlela yokubhalisa ishishini.

eng: free training the cipc also recently launched free online training platform learnibiz to help small, medium and micro enterprise directors and entrepreneurs build their capacity to run successful businesses, while ensuring they comply with the legal requirements.
xho: uqeqesho lwasimahla icipc isandu kuphehlelela iqonga loqeqesho lasimahla kwiintanethi ilearnibiz ukunceda abalawuli bamashishini amancinci, aphakathi kunye nasakhasayo kunye noosomashishini ukuze bakhulise izakhono zabo zokuqhuba amashishini anempumelelo, ngelixa beqinisekisa ukuba bathobela iimfuno zomthetho.

eng: "the platform is a digital study guide and includes video tutorials and a selfexamination for each of the seven modules," said shakung.
xho: eli qonga sisikhokelo sokufunda esidijithali kwaye sibandakanya izifundo zevidiyo kunye nokuzivavanya kwimodyuli nganye kwezi zisixhenxe," utshilo ushakung.

eng: the modules include training on what a company and a director is, key persons in a company, responsibilities of a director, personal financial interests and conflict of interest, re muneration of directors and distributions and the board of directors.
xho: iimodyuli zibandakanya uqeqesho lokuba yintoni inkampani kunye nomlawuli, abantu abaphambili kwinkampani, uxanduva lomlawuli, umdla wobuqu kwezezimali kunye nokungqubana kwemidla, umvuzo wabalawuli nokwabelana ngeenzuzo kunye nabalawuli bebhodi.

eng: to register for the training, visit www.
xho: ukubhalisela uqeqesho, yiya kuwww.

eng: elearning@cipc.co.za.
xho: elearning@cipc.co.za.

eng: companies tribunal dr mohammed chicktay, the chairperson of the ct, explained that the entity helps provide a speedy resolution in company disputes, relating to applications and complaints made in terms of the companies act no.
xho: inkundla yeenkampani ugqr mohammed chicktay, usihlalo wect, ucacise wathi eli qumrhu linceda ngokunika isisombululo esikhawulezayo kwiimbambano zenkampani, ezinxulumene nezicelo kunye nezikhalazo ezenziwe ngokomthetho weenkampani nomb.

eng: 71 of 2008. these include disputes relating to company names, directorship and exemption from establishing social and ethics committees.
it also reviews compliance notices issued by the cipc, relating to time extensions to prepare annual financial statements and convene annual general meetings.
xho: ikwahlola izaziso zokuthobela ezikhutshwe yicipc, ezimalunga nokwandiswa kwexesha lokulungiselela iingxelo zemali zonyaka kunye nokubiza iintlanganiso zikawonkewonke zonyaka.

eng: "the ct deals with various applications.
xho: "ict ijongene nezicelo ezahlukeneyo.

eng: during covid19, for example, we received many applications for an extension of the date to convene an annual general meeting," said chicktay.
xho: umzekelo, ngexesha lecovid19, sifumene izicelo ezininzi zokwandiswa komhla wokubiza intlanganiso kawonkewonke yonyaka," utshilouchicktay.

eng: another free service offered by the ct is dispute resolution.
xho: enye inkonzo yasimahla enikezwa yict kukusombululaimbambano.

eng: a person may refer a matter for resolution by mediation, conciliation or arbitration, as an alternative to going to court.
xho: umntu angathumela umba ukuba usonjululwe ngolamlo, ngoxolelwaniso okanye ngokwahlulwa, njengenye indlelayokuya enkundleni.

eng: covid19 corruption perpetrators brought to book vukuzenzele unnamed individuals and companies who were involved in corruption relating to the gov ernment’s procurement of coronavirus disease (covid19) goods and services are being held accountable for their actions.
xho: abenzi borhwaphilizo lwecovid19 baziswe ngaphambili vukuzenzele unnamed abantu kunye neenkampani ezibandakanyeka kurhwaphilizo olunxu lumene nokuthengwa kweempahla neenkonzo zentsholongwana yecorona (icovid19) zikarhu lumente bayaphenduliswa ngezenzo zabo.

eng: the special investigation unit’s (siu) final report on its probe into allegations relating to any misuse of covid19 funds, across all spheres of government and the private sector was recently authorised for release to the public by president cyril ramaphosa.
xho: ingxelo yeyunithi yophando ekhethekileyo (isiu) emalunga nophando lwayo lwezityholo ezinxulumene nokusetyenziswa gwenxa kwemali yecovid19, kuwo onke amanqwanqwa karhu lumente kunye namacandelo abucala.

eng: in july 2020, president ramaphosa authorised the investigation by the siu.
xho: kutsha nje umongameli ucyril ramaphosa ugunyazise ukuba ikhululelwe uluntu.

eng: at the time, he gave his commitment that if the siu found evidence that a criminal offence had been committed, it would be obliged to refer the evidence to the national prosecuting authority (npa).
xho: le ngxelo linyathelo elibalulekileyo lokulwa u rhwaphilizo kunye nolawulo olugwenxa kumacandelo karhulumente nawabucala, utshilo umongameli.

eng: the siu was also aut horised to institute civil proceedings for the recovery of any damages or losses incurred by the state.
xho: kweyekhala ngowama2020, umongameli ramaphosa wagunyazisa uphando lwesiu.

eng: report findings the siu investigated 5 467 contracts awarded to 3 066 service providers, worth a total of r14.3 billion.
xho: ngelo xesha ke waye wazibophelela ngelithi ukuba ngaba isiu ifumene ubungqina bokuba kwenziwe ityala lolwaphulomthetho, iya kunyanzeleka ukuba idlulisele ubungqina kwigunyabantu lezotshutshiso lesizwe (inpa).

eng: the investigation into 4 549 contracts have been finalised, and 2 803 of these were found to be irregular.
xho: ingxelo yeziphumo isiu iphande iikhontrakthi ezingama5 467 ezinikwe ababonelelinkonzo aba ngama3 066, ezixabisa ir14.3 yeebhiliyoni zizonke.

eng: this amounts to 62% of the finalised investigations.
xho: uphando kwiikhontrakthi ezingama4 549 sele luqukunjelwe, kwaye ezingama 2 803 kuzo zafunyanwa zingekho mgaqweni.

eng: "this investigation targeted individuals and institutions who believed they could exploit a moment of national vulnerability to enrich themselves and those with whom they colluded to abuse public resources," the president said.
xho: umongameli uthe, "olu phando lujolise kubantu kunye namaziko akholelwa ukuba angasebenzisa ixeshana lokuba semngciphekweni kwesizwe ukuze bazityebise kunye nabo bathe basebenzisana nabo ukusebenzisa kakubi izixhobo zoluntu."

eng: he added it was unacceptable that so many contracts associated with saving lives and protecting livelihoods were irregular, unlawful or fraudulent.
xho: wongeza ngelithi akwamkelekanga kwaphela ukuba iikhontrakthi ezininzi ezinxulunyaniswa nokusindisa ubomi kunye nokukhusela iindlela zokuziphilisa kwabantu zazingekho mgangathweni, zingekho mthethweni okanye zinobuqhophololo.

eng: "this investigation demonstrates our determination to root out corruption and to deal with perpetrators," said president ramaphosa.
xho: "olu phando lubonakalisa ukuzimisela kwethu ekuncothuleni neengcambu urhwaphilizo kwanokujongana nabenzi bobubi," utshilo umongameli ramaphosa.

eng: the final report details matters that the siu has referred to the npa, departments and entities in the public sector and other parties.
xho: ingxelo yokugqibela inika iinkcukacha ngemiba esele isiu iyigqithisele kwinpa, amasebe namaqumrhu kwicandelo likarhulumente nakwamanye amaqela.

eng: the npa will finalise the process of bringing wrongdoers to book and addressing weaknesses identified by the siu investigation, the president explained.
xho: umongameli ucacise wathi, inpa iza kuqukumbela inkqubo yokuzisa abenzi bobubi entolongweni kunye nokujongana nobuthakathaka obuqatshelwe luphando lwesiu.

eng: action taken since the start of the investigation, the siu, working with other agencies, has made the following progress: 45 matters, with a combined value of r2.1 billion, have been enrolled with the special tribunal on corruption, fraud and illicit money flows.
xho: inyathelo elithatyathiweyo oko luqalile uphando, isiu, isebenzisana nezinye iiarhente, yenze le nkqubela ilandelayo: imiba engama45, enexabiso elidityanisiweyo ler2.1 yeebhiliyoni, iye yabhaliswa kwinkundla eyodwa yorhwaphilizo, ubuqhophololo kunye nokuhamba kweemali ngokungekho mthethweni.

eng: the special tribunal has a statutory mandate to recover public funds stolen through corruption, fraud and illicit money flows, and take civil action against perpetrators; 224 cases have been referred for disciplinary action against officials in government departments or entities; 386 cases have been referred to the npa, and three have been referred for executive action; 330 cases have been referred for administrative action, which includes blacklisting (not being able to do work for gov ernment).
xho: inkundla ekhethekileyo inegunya elisemthethweni lokubuyisela iimali zoluntu ezibiwe ngorhwaphilizo, ubuqhetseba kunye nokuhamba kwemali ngokungekho mthethweni, kwaye ithathele amanyathelo omthetho kubaphulimthetho; amatyala angama224 athunyelwe ukuze kuthathwe amanyathelo oluleko ngakumagosa kumasebe okanye amaqumrhu karhulumente; amatyala angama386 athunyelwe kwinpa, kwaze amatha thu agqithiswa ukuze umongameli athathwe amanyathelo; amatyala angama330 agqithiselwe kumanyathelo olawulo, aquka ukufakwa kuluhlu lwabantu bangesokuze baphinde benze umsebenzi kurhulumente.

eng: according to the report, a total of r551.5 million (value of cash and assets) is to be recovered, while r34.2 million has been recovered to date.
xho: ngokwengxelo, yir551.5 yezigidi zeerandi (ixabiso lemali nempahla) eza kubuyiswa, ngelixa ir34.2 yezigidi sele ibuyisiwe ukuza kuthi ga ngoku.

eng: the investigation prevented a r114.2 million loss, and set contracts aside valued at r170.4 million.
xho: olu phando luthintele ilahleko yer114.2 yezigidi zeerandi, laze labekela bucala izivumelwano ezixabisa ir170.4 yezigidi.

eng: the siu expects these matters to be completed between march and april 2022, before the submission of a supplementary report to the president at the end of june.
xho: isiu ilindele ukuba le miba igqitywe phakathi kwenyanga yenkwindla nekatshazimpuzi kowama2022, phambi kokuba kungeniswe ingxelo eyongezelelweyo kumongameli ekupheleni kwenyanga yesilimela.

eng: cach connects students with learning opportunities silusapho nyanda young people who have not yet secured spots at higher education institutions can turn to the central application clearing house (cach) system for help.
xho: icach idibanisa abafundi namathuba okufunda silusapho nyanda abantu abatsha abangekazifumani iindawo zokufunda kumaziko emfundo ephakamileyo bangakwazi ukufaka izicelo kwinkqubo yecentral application clearing house (icach) ukuze bafumane uncedo.

eng: cach is an online government service managed by the department of higher education and training (dhet).
xho: icach yinkonzo karhulumente efunyanwa kwiintanethi elawulwa lisebe lemfundo ephakamileyo noqeqesho (idhet).

eng: the service helps those who need access to university, technical and vocational education and training (tvet) colleges and skills development opportunities.
xho: le nkonzo inceda abo bafuna ukufikelela kwiiyunivesithi, iikholeji zemfundo yobugcisa noqeqesho (itvet) kwakunye nokufikelela kumathuba ophuhliso lwezakhono.

eng: "cach services have been available from 24 january 2022, and will close on 31 march, to assist those who need to enter tertiary education but face challenges with getting space," says minister of higher education and training dr blade nzimande.
xho: "iinkonzo zecach sele ziqalile ukufumaneka ukususela ngomhla wama24 kweyomqungu 2022, kwaye ziza kuvalwa ngomhla wama31 kweyokwindla, ngelokunceda abo bafuna ukungena kumaziko emfundo enomsila kodwa bajongane nemiceli mngeni yokufumana indawo," utshilo umphathiswa wemfundo ephakamileyo noqeqesho ugqirha ublade nzimande.

eng: cach can help those who applied for admission to a university or a college on time in 2021, but were not offered a place in a programme of their choice.
xho: icach ingakwazi ukunceda abo abangakhange banikwe ndawo kwizifundo ebebezikhethile, nangona bebefake izicelo zabo zokwamkelwa eyunivesithi okanye ekholejini kwangethuba kunyaka ophelileyo ka2021.

eng: the dhet explained that this usually happens when the applicant does not meet the necessary requirements or the institution has reached its limit on the number of students it can enrol.
xho: idhet icacise yathi oku kudla ngokwenzeka xa umfakisicelo engazifezekisi iimfuno ezibalulekileyo zokufaka isicelo okanye xa iziko lifikelele kumda walo othile wenani labafundi elinokubabhalisa.

eng: cach can also help those who applied to a higher learning institution and were accepted, but now want to change their courses.
xho: kwakhona icach ingakwazi nokunceda nabo babefake izicelo kumaziko emfundo ephakamileyo baza bamkelwa, kodwa ngoku bafuna ukutshintsha izifundo zabo.

eng: cach will refer individuals to career development services and where possible, provide an opportunity for them to be considered for spaces still available at universities, tvet colleges or sector education and training authority (seta) learnerships, without having to travel to any institution.
xho: icach iza kuthumela abantu kwiinkonzo zophuhliso lwamakhono omsebenzi, ukanti xa kunokwenzeka ingabanika nezithuba ezisafumanekayo kwiiyunivesithi nakwiikholeji zetvet okanye uqeqeshelomsebenzi kwicandelo lemfundo noqeqesho (iseta), nga phandle kokuba umfakisicelo ade axhamleke aye ngeenyawo kulo naliphi na iziko.

eng: all public universities, tvet colleges and setas can access the cach database to search for individuals who meet the criteria for available spaces.
xho: zonke iiyunivesithi zikarhulumente, iikholeji zetvet kwakunye neeseta zizakukwazi ukufikelela kwiziko ledatabase yecach zikhangela abantu abahlangabezana nemilinganiselo yezithuba ezisafumanekayo.

eng: "institutions select individuals from the cach database and make direct contact with those they have selected," says dhet spokesperson ishmael mnisi.
xho: "amaziko akhetha abantu kwiziko ledatabase yecach ze aqhagamshelane nabo ngqo abo bathe babakhetha," sitshilo isithethi sedhet uishmael mnisi.

eng: new laws strengthen the fight against gbv vukuzenzele unnamed late last year, i received a letter from a group of concerned citizens calling on the government to protect the women and children of this country from violence.
xho: imithetho emitsha izakuqinisa amasolotya edabi lokuchasana negbv vukuzenzele unnamed ngasekupheleni konyaka ophelileyo, ndafumana ileta esuka kwiqela la bemi abaxhalabileyo becela urhulumente ukuba akhusele amanina nabantwana beli lizwe ebundlobongeleni.

eng: pointing to an increase in rape and sexual assault, they wrote that as women they continue to live in fear; they are losing their faith in the law.
xho: kule leta babecacisa ngokwanda kodlwengulo nokuxhatshazwa ngokwesini, babhala ukuba njengamabhinqa basaqhubeka bephila ngoloyiko; nokulahlekelwa lithemba kwabo kwezomthetho.

eng: i was deeply moved and touched by their account of the fear that the women of our country are subjected to on a daily basis.
xho: ndachukumiseka kakhulu ke kukuva amanina eli lizwe lethu ekhala ngoloyiko lwawo ngenxa yokuphathwa gadalala mihla le.

eng: in response to the suffering that women and children are subjected to, we have passed laws designed to protect them.
xho: ngenzame ke zokusabela kwiimbandezelo abafazi nabantwana aba phantsi kwazo siye sawisa imithetho eyenzelwe ukubakhusela.

eng: but despite penalties to remove perpetrators from society, women and children continue to suffer and die.
xho: nangona kukhona izohlwayo zokushenxisa abenzi bobubi eluntwini, amabhinqa nabantwana basaqhubeka bebandezeleka yaye besifa.

eng: i recently signed into law three pieces of legislation that honour our promises to strengthen the criminal justice system, promote accountability across the state and put support for survivors at the centre of all our efforts.
xho: kutshanje ndiye ndatyikitya iziqendwana ezintathu zomthetho ezihlonipha izithembiso zethu zokuqinisa inkqubo yobulungisa kulwaphulomthetho, ukukhuthaza ukuphendula kurhulumente wonke, kwa kunye nokubeka phambili inkxaso kumaxhoba kuzo zonke iinzame zethu zokukhusela abasetyhini nabantwana.

eng: the new criminal and related matters amendment act protects the vulnerable from secondary victimisation by allowing courts to appoint intermediaries through which a minor, a disabled person or an elderly person can be examined in proceedings.
xho: umthethosihlomelo omtsha wolwaphulomthetho kunye nemiba enxulumene nawo ukhu sela abo basesichengeni sokuxhatshazwa okwesibini ngokuvumela iinkundla ukuba zinyule abameli apho umntwana osemncinane, abantu abakhubazekileyo okanye abolupheleyo behlolwa ngelixa kusaqhuba ityala.

eng: it also allows for the extended use of evidence by means of an audiovisual link.
xho: lo mthetho ukwavumela ukusetyenziswa okwandisiweyo kobungqina ngokusebenzisa iteknolojiyokuthetha ngevidiyo.

eng: this helps to shield a witness against harm, prevent unreasonable delays and save costs in proceedings.
xho: oku kunceda ukukhusela amangqina kwingozi, ukuthintela ukulibaziseka okungafanelekanga kunye nokugcina iindleko zetyala.

eng: the new law also significantly tightens up our bail regime.
xho: umthetho omtsha ukwaluqinisa kakhulu ulawulo lwethu lwebheyile.

eng: a prosecutor who does not oppose bail in designated cases must have their reasons placed on record.
xho: umtshutshisi ongayichasiyo ibheyile kumatyala athile amiselweyo kufuneka izizathu zakhe zibhalwe phantsi.

eng: the court must consider any threats of violence made against the complainant and the complainant’s view of their own safety.
xho: ingoko ke kuzakufuneka inkundla ithathele ingqalelo naziphi na izigrogriso zobundlobongela ezenziwa ngummangalelwa kummangali kunye nezimvo zommangali ngokhuseleko lwakhe.

eng: unless the court is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist that warrant release on bail, bail must be denied.
xho: ngaphandle kokuba ke inkundla yanelisekile ukuba kukho iimeko ezizodwa ezibangela ukuba kukhululwe ummangalelwa ngebheyile, ibheyile kufuneka ingamkelwa.

eng: the new criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act outlaws sexual exploitation and grooming of persons with mental disabilities, and provides that sexual offences against persons who are mentally disabled must be recorded in the national register of sex offenders (nrso).
xho: umthethosihlomelo omtsha womthetho wolwaphulomthetho (ulwaphulomthetho lwezesondo kunye nemiba enxulumene noko) uyakukhaba ukuxhatshazwa ngokwesondo kunye nokuncwaswa kwabantu abakhubazeke ngengqondo, kwaye ubonelela ngokuba izenzo zolwaphulomthetho ngokwesondo ngakubantu abakhubazeke ngokwasengqondweni mazibhalwe kwirejista yesizwe yabaphulimthetho ngokwesondo (inrso).

eng: we have responded to calls to tighten up the management of the nrso.
xho: siye sali sabela ke ikhwelo lokuqinisa ulawulo lwenrso.

eng: those who have been convicted of sex crimes against children or mentally disabled persons, have previous convictions in this respect, and have been sentenced to terms longer than 18, months can only apply to have their names removed from the register after 20 years.
xho: abo bakhe babanjelwa izenzo zolwaphulomthetho ngokwesondo kubantwana okanye abantu abakhubazeke ngokwasengqondweni, kwaye babegwetywe ixesha elingaphezu kweenyanga ezili18 bangade bakwazi ukufaka isicelo sokuba amagama abo asuswe kwirejista emva kweminyaka engama20.

eng: the act further regulates the reporting duty of people who are aware that sexual offences have been committed against vulnerable persons.
xho: lo mthetho ukwalawula umsebenzi wokunika ingxelo wabantu abaziyo ukuba izenzo zolwaphulomthetho ngokwesondo zenziwe kubantu abase sichengeni.

eng: the new domestic violence amendment act takes account of some of the complexities in violent domestic relationships.
xho: umthethosihlomelo omtsha wobundlobongela basekhaya ukwathathela ingqalelo ezinye zeengxaki kubudlelwane basekhaya obunobundlobongela.

eng: we have tightened up the process of obtaining protection orders, and broadened the circumstances under which they can be applied for.
xho: siyiqinisile ke nenkqubo yokufumana isithintelo nemiyalelo yokhuseleko, sikwazandisile neemeko zokufaka isicelo somyalelo wokhuseleko.

eng: we have addressed the issue of women and children being victimised despite having, or being in process of applying for, a protection order.
xho: nalo mcimbi wabasetyhini nabantwana abaxhatshazwayo nangona kukho, okanye bekwinkqubo yokufaka isicelo somyalelo wokhuseleko siwuso mbulile.

eng: if a court believes a complainant is in imminent danger it can issue a protection order immediately without needing to give a respondent notice of the proceedings.
xho: ukuba ngaba inkundla ikholelwa ukubeni ummangali ukufutshane nengozi, inkundla ingakwaziukukhupha umyalelo wokhuseleko ngokukhawuleza ngaphandle kokuba inike ummangalelwa isaziso senkqubo yokuthintela ubudlelwane bakhe nommangali.

eng: significantly, if the court releases someone charged with domestic violence on bail who does not have a protection order granted against them, the court must issue one after holding an enquiry.
xho: into ebalulekileyo kwakhona, kukuba ngaba inkundla iyamkhulula u mntu otyholwa ngobundlobongela basekhaya ngebheyile engenawo umyalelo wokhuseleko awunikiweyo, inkundla kufuneka iwukhuphe emva kokuchotshelwa kophando.

eng: when the court issues a protection order it must at the same time authorise the issuing of an arrest warrant, suspended, that must be provided to the south african police service (saps).
xho: xa inkundla ikhupha umyalelo wokhuseleko kufuneka kwangaxeshanye ikugunyazise ukukhutshwa kwencwadi egunyazisa ukubanjwa, enqunyanyisiwe, myalelo lowo ekufuneka unikezelwe kwinkonzo yamapolisa omzantsi afrika (isaps).

eng: if a saps member suspects a complainant is in danger due to breach of the order, they must arrest the respondent immediately.
xho: ukuba ngaba ilungu lesaps likrokrela ukuba ummangali usengozini ngenxa yokwaphulwa komyalelo, ummangalelwa makabanjwe ngoko nangoko.

eng: the act now expressly protects the elderly from all forms of domestic violence, and also permits complainants to apply for protection orders online, saving them time and travel costs.
xho: ngoku lo mthetho ubakhusela ngokucacileyo abantu abadala kuzo zonke iintlobo zobundlobongela basekhaya, kwaye ukwavumela abamangali ukuba bafake izicelo zokhuseleko kwiintanethi, ukonga ixesha kunye neendleko zokuhamba.

eng: to protect complainants against further abuse, the court may an issue a safety monitoring notice that will require a member of saps to be in constant contact with the complainant without the knowledge of the abuser.
xho: ukukhusela abamangali kwimpathogadalala eyongezelelekileyo, inkundla ingakhupha isaziso sokujonga ukhuseleko isafety monitoring notice esiya kufuna ukuba ilungu lesaps lisoloko linxibelelana nommangali ngaphandle kolwazi lo mxhaphazi.

eng: survivors of gbv often complain of illtreatment or disregard for their concerns when they lay complaints at police stations.
xho: amaxhoba egbv asoloko ekhalazela ukuphathwa kakubi okanye ukungahoywa kweenkxalabo zawo xa efaka izikhalazo kwizikhululo zamapolisa.

eng: saps members who fail to comply with their obligations under the new law will be guilty of misconduct.
xho: phantsi kwalo mthetho mtsha amalungu esaps asilelayo ukuthobela izibophelelo zawo ayakuba netyala lokuziphatha kakubi.

eng: all adult persons who have knowledge or suspicion that domestic violence is being perpetrated against a child, a person with a mental disability or an elderly person are obliged to report such acts to a social worker or to the police.
xho: bonke abantu abadala abanolwazi okanye abakro krela ukuba ubundlobongela basekhaya benziwa emntaneni, umntu okhubazeke ngokwengqondo okanye umntu osele ekhulile banyanzelekile ukuba baxele izenzo ezinjalo kunontlalontle okanye emapoliseni.

eng: failure to do so is a criminal offence.
xho: ukusilela ukwenza oko kuzakuba lityala lolwaphulomthetho.

eng: sona 2022: bettering lives and livelihoods vukuzenzele unnamed government is committed to putting people first, and has given itself 100 days to finalise a plan to involve all sectors of society in growing south africa’s economy, creating jobs and combating hunger.
xho: isona ka2022: ukwenza ubomi neendlela zokuziphilisa ngcono vukuzenzele unnamed urhulumente uzibophelele ukuqinisekisa ukuba abantu baba yeyona nto ibalulekileyo, kwaye uzinike iintsuki ezili100 ukugqibezela isicwangciso esibandakanya onke amacandelo asekuhlaleni ukukhulisa uqoqosho lomzantsi afrika, ukudala imisebenzi nokulwa indlala.

eng: this was emphasised by president cyril ramaphosa in his 2022 state of the nation address.
xho: oku kuye kwagxininiswa ngumongameli cyril ramaphosa kwintetho yakhe engobume besizwe ka2022.

eng: "this work will build on the foundation of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan, which remains our common programme to rebuild the economy," he said.
xho: "lo msebenzi uza kukwakha isiseko sesicwangciso sokwakhiwa ngokutsha nokuvuselelwa koqoqosho, nto leyo eseyinkqubo yethu sonke yokwakha kwakhona uqoqosho," utshilo.

eng: the president said government’s priorities are overcoming the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic, building infrastructure, increasing local production, creating jobs and addressing the energy crisis.
xho: umongameli uthe izinto eziphambili kurhulumente kukoyisa ubhubhane wesifo sentsholongwane yecorona (icovid19), ukwakha amaseko, ukonyusa iimveliso zeli, ukudala imisebenzi nokulungisa ingxaki yamandla ombane.

eng: "if there is one thing we all agree on, it is that the present situation – of deep poverty, unemployment and inequality – is unacceptable and unsustainable."
xho: "ukuba kukho into enye esivumelana ngayo sonke, kukuba le meko ikhoyo ngoku – yentlupheko enzulu, intswelangqesho nokungalingani – ayamkelekanga kwaye ayinakho ukuhlala inje."

eng: creating jobs last year, the unemployment rate reached its highest recorded level of 34.9% in the third quarter, following the financial devastation caused by covid19.
xho: ukudala imisebenzi kulo nyaka uphelileyo, izinga lentswelangqesho liye lafikelela kwelona nqanaba liphezulu elakhe labonwa lama34.9% kwikota yesithathu, emveni kwentshabalalo ebangelwe yicovid19.

eng: "we all know that government does not create jobs.
xho: "sonke siyazi ukuba urhulumente akadali misebenzi.

eng: business creates jobs.
xho: ngamashishini adala imisebenzi.

eng: the key task of government is to create the conditions that will enable the private sector – both big and small – to emerge, to grow, to access new markets, to create new products, and to hire more employees," he said.
xho: owona msebenzi karhulumente ubalulekileyo kukudala iimeko eziza kwenza ukuba icandelo labucala – elincinci nelikhulu – livele, likhule, likwazi ukungena kwiimarike ezintsha, livelise iimveliso ezintsha, nokuba liqeshe abantu abongezelelekileyo," utshilo.

eng: around 80% of employed people work in the private sector.
xho: malunga ne80% yabantu abaqeshiweyo basebenza kwicandelo labucala.

eng: the president said government will introduce a new loan guarantee scheme to help small businesses recover.
xho: umongameli uthe urhulumente uza kukwazisa inkqubo entsha yokuqinisekisa imalimboleko ukunceda amashishini amancinci ukuba achache kwakhona.

eng: the presidential employment stimulus programme, which has already supported over 850 000 employment opportunities, will be stepped up.
xho: inkqubo yoburhulumente yovuselelo lwengqesho, esele ixhase ngaphaya kwamathuba engqesho angama850 000, iza konyuswa.

eng: most of the beneficiaries were young people; over 60% were women.
xho: uninzi lwabaxhamli ibingabantu abancinci; ngaphaya kwe60% ngamanina.

eng: the employment stimulus will enable the department of home affairs to recruit 10 000 unemployed youth for the digitisation of paper records, and the social employment fund will create another 50 000 work opportunities.
xho: uvuselelo lwengqesho luza kwenza ukuba isebe lemicimbi yekhaya lifune abantu abatsha abangama10 000 abangaqeshwanga ukuba basebenze ukwenza iingxelo esisemaphepheni zibe dijithali, ingxowamali yentswelangqesho yoluntu iza kudala amanye amathuba omsebenzi angama50 000. isebe lemfundo ephakamileyo noqeqesho liza kufaka abantu abangama10 000 abangaphangeliyo abaphumelele imfundo yobugcisa nemisebenzi yezandla kunye nezithwalandwe zoqeqesho kwiindawo zokusebenza ukususela kwekatshazimpuzi 2022. iqonga lesayouth.

eng: the department of higher education and training will place 10 000 unemployed technical and vocational education and training graduates in workplaces from april 2022. the sayouth.
xho: mobi elinceda ulutsha olukhangela imisebenzi lukwazi ukufikelela kumathuba ngoku linolutsha olungaphaya kwezigidi eziyi2.3 olubhalisiweyo.

eng: of these, over 600 000 have been placed into employment opportunities.
xho: kwaba, ngaphaya kwama600 000 sele befakwe emisebenzini.

eng: "a revitalised national youth service will recruit its first cohort of 50 000 young people during the next year [2023], creating opportunities for young people to contribute to their communities, develop their skills and grow their employability."
xho: "inkonzo yesizwe yolutsha evuselelweyo iza kukhangela iqela layo lokuqala labantu abatsha abangama50 000 kulo nyaka uzayo [ku2023], ibe idalela abantu abatsha amathuba okuba negalelo kwiindawo abahlala kuzo, ukuphuhlisa izakhono zabo nokukhulisa ukuqesheka kwabo."

eng: srd grant continuesthe covid19 social relief of distress (srd) grant, which has helped over 10 million unemployed people, has been extended for another year – to the end of march 2023. in addition, government and its partners will look at ways to continue to support people in financial distress in a manner that is affordable to the country over the long term.
xho: isibonelelo sesrd siyaqhubeka isibonelelo sesiqabu senkxwaleko (isrd) secovid19, esele sincede ngaphaya kwezigidi ezili10 zabantu abangaphangeliyo, sandisiwe ngomnye unyaka – de kube sekupheleni kweyokwindla 2023. ngaphaya koko, urhulumente nabo asebenza nabo baza kukhangela iindlela zokuqhubeka nokuxhasa abantu abaphantsi koxinzelelo lwenkxwaleko ngendlela engazi kuxabisa ilizwe kakhulu kwixesha elide elizayo.

eng: access to land government is moving ahead with land reform and anticipates the approval of the expropriation bill this year.
xho: ukufikelela kumhlaba urhulumente uyaqhubeka nohlaziyo lomhlaba kwaye ulindele ukuba umthetho oyilwayo wokoxhuthwa komhlaba upasiswe kulo nyaka.

eng: the establishment of the agriculture and land reform development agency will also be finalised this year.
xho: ukusekwa kwearhente yohlaziyo nophuhliso lolimo nomhlaba nako kuza kugqitywa kulo nyaka.

eng: "the department of public works and infrastructure will finalise the transfer of 14 000 hectares of state land to the housing development agency," the president said.
xho: "isebe lemisebenzi yoluntu namaseko liza kugqiba ukutshintshelwa kweehektare ezingama14 000 zomhlaba karhulumente uye kwiarhente yophuhliso lwezindlu," utshilo umongameli.

eng: he added that there is enough arable land to support millions of thriving smallscale farmers in poultry, livestock, fruit and vegetables.
xho: wongeze ngelithi kukho umhlaba owaneleyo olimekayo ukuxhasa izigidi zabalimi abakwizinga elincinci beenkukhu, imfuyo, iziqhamo nemifuno.

eng: already, over 100 000 farmers have received input vouchers to expand their production and the programme will be expanded to reach more farmers.
xho: sele kukho ngaphaya kwabalimi abangama100 000 abafumene iivawutsha zeembewu ukwandisa iimveliso zabo kwaye le nkqubo iza kongezwa ukuba ifikelele kubalimi abongezelelekileyo.

eng: corruption and crime from instituting the commission of inquiry into state capture, to investigating covid19related procurement contracts, president ramaphosa is leaving no stone unturned when it comes to ending corruption.
xho: urhwaphilizo nolwaphulomthetho ukususela ekusekeni ikomishoni yophando ejonge ukubanjwa kwelizwe, ukuya ekuphandeni izivumelwano zokuthengwa kwezinto ezoyamene necovid19, umongameli ramaphosa uguqulula yonke into xa kufikelelwa ekupheliseni urhwaphilizo.

eng: "none of our efforts to revive our economy will succeed if we do not tackle the scourge of corruption once and for all," the president said.
xho: "akho nanye kwiinzame zethu zokuvuselela uqoqosho eliza kuphumelela ukuba asilwi esi sibetho sorhwaphilizo kube kanye," utshilo umongameli.

eng: by no later than 30 june 2022, he will present a plan of action in response to the commission’s recommendations.
xho: ungagqithanga umhla wama30 kweyesilimela, uza kuhambisa isicwangciso sentshukumo njengempendulo yeengcebiso zekomishoni.

eng: he explained that various government agencies were working together to identify wrongdoers, punish them, and to get looted state money refunded.
xho: ucacise ukuba iiarhente ezahlukeneyo zikarhulumente bezisebenzisana ukuchonga abenzi bobubi, ukubohlwaya, nokuze benze kubuyiswe imali karhulumente ethe yebiwa.

eng: safety and security will be strengthened through the recruitment of 12 000 police personnel and the reestablishment of community policing forums.
xho: ukhuselo nokhuseleko luza komelezwa ngokukhangelwa kwabasebenzi bamapolisa abangama12 000 nokusekwa kwakhona kwamaqonga obupolisa asekuhlaleni.

eng: fighting gbvf government will also continue to intensify the fight against genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf) this year, through the implementation of the national strategic plan on gbvf.
xho: ukulwa igbvf urhulumente uza kuphinda aqhubeke nokuqinisa umlo ngakubundlobongela obusekelwe kwisini nokubulawa kwabasetyini (igbvf) kulo nyaka, ngokumiselwa kwesicwangciso sesizwe secebo esingegbvf.

eng: three new laws are already working to strengthen the criminal justice system and support survivors.
xho: imithetho emithathu emitsha sele isebenza ukomeleza inkqubo yobulungisa yolwaphulomthetho ixhase abo basindileyo.

eng: "the implementation of this legislation will go a long way to ensuring that cases are successfully prosecuted, that survivors are protected and that there are more effective deterrents in place."
xho: "ukumiselwa kwalo mthetho kuza kuhamba umgama omde ekuqinisekiseni ukuba izehlo zitshutshiswa ngokuyimpumelelo, ukuba abo basindileyo bayakhuselwa nokuba kumiselwa izithintelo ezisebenzayo.

eng: one of the new laws that president ramaphosa was referring to is the criminal and related matters amendment act which protects the vulnerable from secondary victimisation.
xho: "omnye wale mithetho mitsha athetha ngayo umongameli ramaphosa ububhekise kumthethosilungiso wabophulimthetho nemiba eyoyamene nayo okhusela abo basengozini ekubeni ngamaxhoba okwesibini.

eng: this act allows the courts to appoint intermediaries through which a minor, a disabled person or an elderly person can be examined in proceedings.
xho: lo mthetho uvumela iinkundla ukuba zichonge abalamli ukuba abangathi abantwana abancinci, abantu abakhubazekileyo okanye abantu abolupheleyo bangahlolwa ngayo ngethuba kuqhutywa iinkqubo zenkundla.

eng: the president was also referring to the new criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act which outlaws sexual exploitation and grooming of persons with mental disabilities.
xho: umongameli ebekwathetha ngomthethosilungiso omtsha wolwaphulomthetho (amatyala ezesondo kunye nemiba eyoyamene nawo) okhupha emthethweni ukusetyenziswa ngokwesondo nokuncwasa abantu abakhubazeke ngokwengqondo.

eng: this act also states that sexual offences against persons who are mentally disabled must be recorded in the national register of sex offenders.
xho: lo mthetho ukwaxela ukuba amatyala ezesondo ngakubantu abakhubazeke ngokwengqondo kufuneka bafakwe kumqulu wesizwe waboni bezesondo.

eng: end of state of disaster in sight for sa vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril ramaphosa recently announced in his 2022 state of the nation address (sona) that government plans to scrap the national state of disaster as the coun try enters a new phase in the management of the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic.
xho: ukuphela kwemeko yentlekele kusondele emzantsi afrika vukuzenzele unnamed umongameli cyril ramaphosa usandula ukubhengeza kwintetho yakhe engobume besizwe (isona) ka2022 ukuba urhulumente uceba ukuphelisa imeko yentlekele yesizwe njengokuba ilizwe lingena kwisigaba esitsha solawulo lobhubhane wesifo sentsholongwane yecorona (icovid19).

eng: "it is our intention to end the national state of disaster as soon as we have finalised other measures under the national health act and other legislation to contain the pandemic," said the president.
xho: "yinjongo yethu uku phelisa imeko yentlekele yesizwe ngokukhawuleza sakube sigqibe amanye amanyathelo phantsi komthetho wempilo wesizwe neminye imithetho ukulawula lo bhubhane," utshilo umongameli.

eng: on 15 march 2020, president ramaphosa declared the national state of disaster in terms of the disaster management act and announced a range of measures to contain the covid19 outbreak.
xho: ngomhla we15 kweyokwindla 2020, umongameli ramaphosa wabhengeza imeko yentlekele yesizwe ngokwemimiselo yomthetho wolawulo lwentlekele waze wazisa uluhlu lwamanyathelo okunqanda ukwanda koqhambuko lwecovid19.

eng: president ramaphosa said nearly all restrictions on economic and social activity have already been lifted, which is largely thanks to the vaccination rollout programme.
xho: umongameli ramaphosa uthe phantse zonke izithintelo ezikwiintshukumo zoqoqosho nezasekuhlaleni sele zisusiwe, kwaye uninzi lwazo ngenxa yokuqhutywa kwenkqubo yokugonya.

eng: he reminded citizens that vaccines are the best defence against illness, death and covid19, which has claimed close to 100 000 lives locally.
xho: ukhumbuze abemi beli ukuba amachiza okugonya ayeyona ndlela ihamba phambili yokuzikhusela ngasekuguleni, ekufeni nakwicovid19, esele ithathe ubomi babantu abaphantse bafikelele kuma100 000 kweli.

eng: "i've always said from a personal point of view, had i have not been vaccinated, in december when i contracted covid19, i probably will not be standing here," he reflected.
xho: "oko ndatsho ukuba ngokubona kwam, ukuba bendingagonyanga, ngeyomnga ukufumana kwam icovid19, mhlawumbi ngendingemanga apha ngoku," utshilo ecinga emva.

eng: the president took the time to urge south africans to take the lifesaving jab and continue to observe basic health measures and remain vigilant.
xho: umongameli uthabathe ithuba ukubongoza abemi bomzantsi afrika ukuba bafumane isitofu esisindisa ubomi nokuba baqhubeke nokulandela amanyathelo ezempilo asisiseko nokuba bahlale bethe qwa.

eng: "we will be able to get on with our lives, even with the virus in our midst," he said, adding that the pandemic has exacerbated the divide between those who are employed and those who are jobless.
xho: "siza kukwazi ukuqhubeka nobomi bethu, nokuba le ntsholongwane isephakathi kwethu," utshilo, esongeza ngelithi lo bhubhane wenze mandundu iyantlukwano phakathi kwabo baqeshiweyo nabo bangenamisebenzi.

eng: solidarity fund president ramaphosa announced that the solidarity fund has raised r3.4 billion from more than 300 000 south africans and companies, while more than 400 individuals and 100 companies volunteered their time and services.
xho: ingxowamali yomanyano umongameli ramaphosa ubhengeze ukuba ingxowamali yomanyano sele iqokelele ir3.4 yeebhiliyoni kubemi bomzantsi afrika neenkampani, ngethuba ngaphaya kwama400 abantu neenkampani ezili100 zizinikele ngexesha neenkonzo zazo.

eng: "the fund has played a pivotal role in supporting the national health response and alleviating the humanitarian crisis that confronted our country and our people.
xho: "le ngxowamali idlale indima engundoqo ekuxhaseni impendulo yesizwe yempilo nokunciphisa ingxaki yoluntu eliye lajongana nayo ilizwe nabantu."

eng: "he thanked everyone who contributed to the fund, including some members of parliament, and other initiatives to support those affected by the pandemic.
xho: ubulele wonke umntu oye wafaka isandla kule ngxowamali, kuquka namalungu epalamente kunye namanye amaphulo ukuxhasa abo bachatshazelwe ngulo bhubhane.

eng: the president also paid tribute to the many healthcare and frontline workers who play a key role in the fight against covid19.
xho: umongameli ukwanike imbeko kubasebenzi abaninzi bezempilo abasebenza nabantu bedlala indima ebalulekileyo kumlo onxamnye necovid19.

eng: "the nation owes a great debt of gratitude to the dedicated health workers and to other frontline staff who put their own health and lives at risk to care for the ill and the vulnerable during this period," he said.
xho: "isizwe sityala umbulelo omkhulu kubasebenzi bezempilo abazinikeleyo nakwabanye abantu abasebenza phambili ababeke iimpilo zabo nobomi babo emngciphekweni ukukhathalela abo bagulayo nababuthathaka ngeli xesha," utshilo.

eng: – sanews.
xho: – sanews.

eng: gov.
xho: gov.

eng: public and private sector key to economic growth vukuzenzele unnamed as we work to grow our economy and create employment, there is much debate about the relative roles of the state and business in pursuing these goals.
xho: amacandelo karhulumente nelabucala abalulekile ekukhuleni koqoqosho vukuzenzele unnamed njengokuba sisebenzela ukukhulisa uqoqosho lwethu nokudala imisebenzi, kukho iingxoxo ezininzi malunga nokoyamana kwendima yombuso neyamashishini ekufezekiseni ezi njongo.

eng: some people have suggested that we must make a choice between, on the one hand, a developmental state that plays a vital role in economic and social transformation, and, on the other, a vibrant, expanding private sector that drives growth and employment.
xho: abanye abantu bacebise ukuba kufuneka sikhethe phakathi kombuso wophuhliso odlala indima ebalulekileyo kwinguqu yoqoqosho nasekuhlaleni kwelinye icala kunye necandelo labucala elikhulayo elidlamkileyo neliqhuba ukukhula nengqesho kwelinye icala.

eng: the reality is that we need both.
xho: eneneni sizidinga zombini.

eng: we need a capable developmental state and a dynamic and agile private sector.
xho: sidinga umbuso wophuhliso onobuchule kunye necandelo labucala elinamandla nelikhawulezayo.

eng: we need them to work together and complement each other.
xho: sidinga ukuba asebenzisane ancedisane apho elinye lisilela khona.

eng: this idea is not new.
xho: lo mbono awukho mtsha.

eng: thirty years ago, in 1992, the african national congress adopted a document titled "ready to govern".
xho: kwiminyaka engamashumi amathathu eyagqithayo, ngo1992, iafrican national congress yamkela njengeyalo uxwebhu olunesihloko esithi ‘ready to govern’.

eng: the document set out policy guidelines for a democratic south africa and has, over nearly three decades, influenced the policy direction of successive democratic administrations.
xho: olu xwebhu lwaluqulethe izikhokelo zomgaqonkqubo womzantsi afrika wenta ndo yesininzi kwaye kwiminyaka engaphaya kwamashumi amathathu sele ube nempembelelo kwindlela ethathwa ngumgaqonkqubo wolawulo lwentando yesininzi olulandelelanayo.

eng: the "ready to govern" document envisaged a democratic state with ultimate responsibility for coordinating, planning and guiding the development of the economy towards a sustainable growth pattern’ in cooperation with the trade union movement, business and other organs of society.
xho: uxwebhu oluthi ‘ready to govern’ lalinombono wombuso wentando yesininzi onoxanduva olupheleleyo ‘lokuququzelela, ukucwangcisa nokukhokela uphuhliso loqoqosho luhambe ngendlela yokukhula ezinzileyo’ lusebenzisana nentshukumo yeemanyano zorhwebo, amashishini kunye namanye amalungu oluntu.

eng: it spoke of the need for economic policy that democratises the economy and creates productive employment opportunities at a living wage for all south africans.
xho: luquka nemfuneko yokubakho komgaqonkqubo woqoqosho owenza uqoqosho lube yintando yesininzi nodala amathuba engqesho aphuhlisayo apho bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika bafumana umvuzo olungele ukuphila.

eng: the document further envisages a dynamic private sector, employing the skills and acumen of all south africans … and of business activities which contribute significantly to job creation, being actively encouraged.
xho: olu xwebhu lukwanombono ‘wecandelo labucala elinamandla, elisebenzisa zonke izakhono nobukrelekrele babo bonke abemi bomzantsi afrika… nalapho izenzo zoshishino olunegalelo elikhulu ekudaleni imisebenzi zikhuthazwayo.’kwintetho engobume besizwe esandula ukubakho, ndiye ndenza amagqabantshintshi malunga nendlela ekumelwe ukuba urhulumente, amashishini nabasebenzi basebenze kunye ngayo, inye isebenzisa izakhono zayo ezikhethekileyo ukudala imisebenzi.

eng: in the recent state of the nation address, i outlined how government, business and labour should work together, each using their unique capabilities, to create jobs.
xho: enye yezona zinto ezibalulekileyo eziqhuba ukukhula nengqesho ngamashishini karhulumente (iisoe).

eng: one of the most important drivers of growth and employment are stateowned enterprises (soes).
xho: avelisa umbane, alawula amazibuko, akha iindlela kwaye azisa amanzi adingwa luqoqosho ukuze lusebenze.

eng: they generate electricity, manage the ports, build the roads and supply the water that the economy needs to function.
xho: oko kwathi kwaqala intando yesininzi, ezi soe sele zandise ukufikeleleka kweenkonzo ezisisiseko ebantwini abahlelelekileyo ngendlela ebonakalayo.

eng: since the advent of democracy, these soes have significantly expanded access to basic services for the poor.
xho: yiyo le nto inxalenye eba lulekileyo yenkqubo yethu ikukomeleza amashishini karhulumente, ukuvuselela impilo yawo yezezimali, ukuphucula indlela asebenza ngayo nokuwenza akwazi ukudlala indima ebonakala nangakumbi nenegalelo eliluncedo kuqoqosho.

eng: that is why a critical part of our programme is to strengthen stateowned enterprises, restoring them to financial health, improving their operational performance and enabling them to play a more prominent and beneficial role in the economy.
xho: ngokuhambelana nendima engumbono we‘ready to govern’, umbuso ukhokela ukukhula nenguqu usebenzisa izixhobo ezifana nomgaqonkqubo wokhuphiswano, izibonelelo zokuxhotyiswa ngokubanzi ngokwezoqoqosho kwabamnyama kunye nemithetho yolingano, nangokudibanisa ukunikwa kwamaphephamvume ohlukeneyo kwiinkonzo jikelele nezibophelelo zokuxhobisa.

eng: true to the role envisaged in "ready to govern", the state directs both growth and transformation through levers like competition policy, broadbased black economic empowerment provisions and employment equity laws, and by linking the award of various licences to universal service and empowerment obligations.
xho: urhulumente ukwachaphazeleka ngqo ekudalweni kwemisebenzi engeyiyo eyabantu abaqeshwe ngurhulumente.

eng: government is also directly involved in employment creation beyond those people employed in the public service.
xho: inkqubo eyandisiweyo yemisebenzi yoluntu, eyasungulwa ngo2003, sele inike amathuba emisebenzi kwizigidi zabantu.

eng: the expanded public works programme, which has been in existence since 2003, has provided work opportunities to millions of people.
xho: kutsha nje, njengempendulo yentshabalalo yefuthe lobhubhane wecovid19, lo rhulumente uye wongamela okona kwandiswa kubalulekileyo kokuqeshwa koluntu kwimvelaphi yelizwe lethu.

eng: more recently, in response to the devastating economic impact of the covid19 pandemic, this government has overseen the most significant expansion of public employment in our country’s history.
xho: uvuselelo lwengqesho lukamongameli luxhase ngaphaya kwamathuba angama850 000 ngeenyanga nje ezili16.

eng: in addition to expanding public employment, we are providing support to unemployed young people to prepare them for work, make them more employable and connect them to opportunities.
xho: ngaphaya kokwandisa ingqesho yoluntu, lunika inkxaso kulutsha olungasebenziyo ukululungiselela umsebenzi, ukulwenza luqesheke nokuludibanisa namathuba.

eng: there are many other ways in which government is contributing directly to job creation, including through largescale investments in infrastructure, the establishment of special economic zones and through support to labourintensive growth industries.
xho: zininzi ezinye iindlela urhulumente angaba negalelo ngqo ngazo ekudaleni imisebenzi, kuquka notyalomali olubanzi kumaseko, ukusekwa kwemida ekhethekileyo yoqoqosho nangokuxhasa ukukhula okusebenza nzima kwamashishini.

eng: a special focus this year is on small, medium and micro businesses, on cooperatives and the informal sector.
xho: siza kugxila ngokukodwa kulo nyaka kumashishini amancinci, aphakathi namancinci kakhulu, kumashishini ajolise ekunikeni inkonzo ethile nakwicandelo elingekho sesikweni.

eng: through the redesign of the loan guarantee scheme that we introduced in the early months of the covid19 pandemic, we are making ‘bounce back’ finance more accessible for small businesses.
xho: ngokuyilwa kwakhona kwenkqubo yesiqinisekiso semalimboleko esiyazise kwiinyanga zokuqala zobhubhane wecovid19, senza inkxasomali yokuchacha kwakhona ifikeleleke lulana kumashi shini amancinci.

eng: we are expanding the employment tax incentive and looking at various other regulatory changes to make it easier for small businesses to employ more people.
xho: sandisa inkuthazo yerhafu yengqesho kwaye sijonga olunye uluhlu lotshintsho lolawulo ukwenza kube lula ukuba amashishini amancinci aqeshe abantu abongezelelekileyo.

eng: as i indicated in the state of the nation address, these are among the measures we are taking as government to create the conditions that will enable the private sector – both big and small – to emerge, to grow, to access new markets, to create new products, and to hire more employees.
xho: njengokuba benditshilo kwintetho engobume besizwe, ezi ziphakathi kwamanyathelo esiwathabathayo njengorhulumente "ukudala iimeko eziza kwenza icandelo labucala – elikhulu nelincinci – livele, likhule, lingene kwiimarike ezintsha, ukudala iimveliso ezintsha nokuqesha abasebenzi abongezelelekileyo.

eng: the private sector employs some three quarters of south africa’s workers and accounts for over twothirds of investment and research and development expenditure.
xho: "icandelo labucala liqesha isithathu kwisine sabasebenzi bomzantsi afrika kwaye lingunobangela wesibini kwisithathu lwenkcitho yotyalomali kunye nophando nophuhliso.

eng: alongside a capable and developmental state, our country therefore needs a thriving private sector that is investing in productive capacity.
xho: ndawonye nombuso onobuchule nophuhliso, ilizwe lethu lidinga icandelo labucala elichachayo elityala imali kwimveliso.

eng: as private sector employment expands, more livelihoods are supported and sustained.
xho: njengokuba ingqesho isanda kwicandelo labucala, kuxhaswa kwaye kugcinwa iindlela zokuziphiilisa ezongezelelekileyo.

eng: goods and services are delivered at a greater scale and the democratic state is able to collect more revenue for social development.
xho: izinto neenkonzo zihanjiswa ngezinga elingaphezulu kwaye umbuso wentando yesininzi uyakwazi ukuqokelela ingeniso eyongezelelekileyo ukuphuhlisa uluntu.

eng: special tribunal is showing that crime does not pay vukuzenzele unnamed during the recent presidential imbizo in mahikeng, several citizens raised concerns about the pace of the fight against corruption.
xho: inkundla ekhethekileyo ibonisa ukuba ulwaphulomthetho alubhatali allison cooper ngexesha lembizo kamongameli yakutshanje emahikeng, abemmi abaninzi bavakalise iinkxalabo malunga nesantya sokulwa urhwaphilizo.

eng: they told me what i have heard in many other communities across the country: that the perpetrators of such acts are known, not least because they flaunt the proceeds of their crimes.
xho: bandi xelele into endiyivileyo kwezinye iindawo zokuhlala kwilizwe liphela: ukuba abenzi bezenzo ezinje bayaziwa, kuba baqhayisela ngeenzuzo zolwaphulomthetho lwabo.

eng: but the arm of the law is long.
xho: kodwa ingalo yomthetho inde.

eng: those who have stolen from the state may believe they have gotten away with it.
xho: abo babileyo kurhu lumente banokukholelwa ukuba babhungcile.

eng: they will learn that crime does not pay.
xho: baza kufunda ukuba ulwaphulomthetho alubhatali.

eng: in this regard, one of our most effective weapons in the fight against corruption and state capture is the special tribunal of the special investigating unit (siu), which i established in 2019. it adjudicates on matters that the siu institutes for civil litigation after it has concluded its investigations.
xho: ngokubhekiselele koku, esinye sezona zixhobo zethu zisebenzayo eku lweni urhwaphilizo kunye nokubanjwa ngobhongwane kombuso yinkundla ekhethekileyo yecandelo lophando elikhethekileyo (isiu), endaliseka ngowama2019.

eng: the special tribunal was set up to speed up litigation.
xho: igweba kwimiba ethi isiu iyisungulele ama tyala oluntu emva kokuba iluqukumbele uphando lwayo.

eng: this approach has made it possible for public funds and state assets lost to corrupt acts to be recovered faster, avoiding delays in the high courts, where the siu has to wait its turn together with other litigants.
xho: le ndlela yenze ukuba imali karhulumente kunye neempahla zikarhulumente ezithe zalahleka kwizenzo zorhwaphilizo zibuyiselwe ngokukhawuleza, kuthi ntelwe ukulibaziseka kwii nkundla eziphakamileyo, apho isiu bekunyanzeleke ukuba ilinde ithuba layo kunye nabanye abamangali.

eng: the siu can request preservation orders and the freezing of assets to prevent further losses to the state.
xho: isiu inokucela imiyalelo yogcino kunye nokuthintelwa kokusetyenziswa kwempahla ukuthintela ilahleko eyongezelelweyo kurhulumente.

eng: this is important when considering that per petrators who are under suspicion often go to great lengths to move around, hide or dispose of proceeds of corruption.
xho: oku kubalulekile xa kuqwalaselwa ukuba abenzi bobubi abarhanelwayo badla ngokwenza inzame ezi nkulu zokuhambisa, bafihle okanye balahle iinzuzo zorhwaphilizo.

eng: there can be no doubt the special tribunal has been a game changer.
xho: akukho mathandabuzo ukuba inkundla ekhethekileyo iye yaguqula izinto.

eng: since its establishment, the tribunal has recovered around r8.6 billion from unlawful contracts.
xho: ukususela ekusekweni kwayo, inkundla yama tyala iye yafumana malunga ner8.6 yeebhiliyoni zeerandi kwiikhontrakthi ezingekho mthethweni.

eng: for any fight against corruption to be deemed effective, it is not sufficient that perpetrators are pro secuted.
xho: ukuze nawuphi na umlo ochasene norhwaphilizo ubonakale unempumelelo, akwanelanga ukuba abenzi bobubi batshutshiswe.

eng: the proceeds of their crimes must be recovered.
xho: iinzuzo zolwaphulomthe tho lwabo kufuneka zibu yiselwe.

eng: this money belongs to citizens and should be used to meet their needs.
xho: le mali yeyabemmi kwaye kufuneka isetyenziselwe ukuhlangabezana neemfuno zabo.

eng: the special tribunal recently ordered two construction companies to return the profits they earned from r40 million in contracts to erect the beit bridge border fence.
xho: inkundla ekhethekileyo kutsha nje iyalele iinkampani ezimbini zokwakha ukuba zibuyise iingeniso eziyifumene kumar40 ezigidi zeekontrakthi zokwakha ucingo lomda webeit bridge.

eng: this followed an investigation by the siu that uncovered a number of irregularities, including a prepayment to the companies by the department of public works and infrastructure.
xho: oku kula ndela uphando olwenziwa yisiu oluthe lwafumanisa izinto ezininzi ezitenxileyo, eziquka ukuhlawulwa kwangaphambili kwiinkampani lisebe lemisebenzi karhulumente neziseko ezingundoqo.

eng: over the past few weeks alone, the tribunal has reviewed and set aside more than r100 million worth of irregular and unlawful contracts arising from covidrelated pro curement.
xho: kwezi veki zimbalwa zidlulileyo zizodwa, inkundla yamatyala iye yaphonononga kwaye yabekela bucala ngaphezulu kwer100 lezigidi zeekhontrakthi ezingafanelekanga nezingekho mthethweni ezivela kwiinkqubo zokufumana abanikizinkonzo ezinxulumene necovid19.

eng: the special tribunal has also been successful in getting back money from senior executives in stateowned enterprises who conducted irregular business activities.
xho: inkundla ekhethekileyo iye yabanempumelelo ekufumaneni imali kubaphathi abaphezulu abakumashishini karhulumente abaqhube imisebenzi engafanelekanga yoshishino.

eng: for example, last year a former transnet executive was ordered to pay r26 million he received as a shareholder of a firm of consulting engineers contracted to transnet while he was a fulltime employee.
xho: umzekelo, kulo nyaka uphelileyo owayesakuba sisigqeba sakwatransnet wayalelwa ukuba ahlawule amar26 ezigidi zeerandi awazifumanayo njengo mninizabelo kwishishini leenjineli zabacebisi ngokuthi abengumcebisi wakwatransnet ngethuba wayengumsebenzi wesi gxina.

eng: the siu has in a number of cases approached the tribunal to delay the payment of pension benefits, pending the outcome of its investigations, to public servants implicated in financial irregularities or fruitless and wasteful expenditure.
xho: isiu iye kwinkundla yamatyala ngenxa yamatyala amaninzi ukulibazisa ukuhlawulwa kwezibonelelo zomhlalaphantsi, kusalindwe iziphumo zo phando lwayo, kubasebenzi bakarhulumente abachaphazeleka kwizitenxo zemali okanye kwiinkcitho ezingenanzuzo neziyilahleko.

eng: the cases before the special tribunal show that much work still needs to be done to strengthen governance and management across all arms of the state.
xho: amatyala aphambi kwenkundla ekhethekileyo abonisa ukuba usemninzi umsebenzi ekusafuneka wenziwe ukuqinisa ula wulo lukarhulumente kunye nolawulo kuwo onke amasebe karhulumente.

eng: they point to serious lapses on the part of accounting officers and failures to adhere to laws and regulations governing procurement i have said before that winning the war on cor ruption will be difficult, and that it will take time to unravel the vast webs of patronage that had become entrenched.
xho: bachaza ukusilela okumandla kwicala lamagosa anika ingxelo kunye nokusilela ekuthobeleni imithetho nemigaqo elawula iinkqubo zokufumana abanikizinkonzo.

eng: i have also maintained that we must fight private sector corruption with equal vigour, because for every public sector employee willing to be bribed, there is a business person willing to pay a bribe.
xho: ndakhe ndatsho ngaphambili ukuba ukuphumelela umlo worhwaphilizo kuza kuba nzima, kwaye kuza kutha tha ixesha ukucombulula intaphane yamagunya alawula ukuqeshwa kwabantu esele imiliselwe.

eng: these corrupt relationships have eroded the capacity of the state to deliver on its mandate.
xho: ndikwayigcinile into yokuba kufuneka silwe urhwaphilizo lwecandelo labucala ngamandla alinganayo, kuba kuye wonke umsebenzi wecandelo likarhulumente ozimiseleyo ukunyotywa, kukho usomashishini ozimiseleyo ukunyoba.

eng: they have set back the state’s efforts to provide decent healthcare, to deliver clean water, and to ensure a consistent supply of power to communities and businesses.
xho: obu budlelwane borhwaphilizo buye baphazamisa amandla karhulumente okuphumeza igunya lakhe.

eng: all you need to know about epilepsy vukuzenzele unnamed most people with epilepsy can live a normal life if they take their medication and the condition is well controlled.
xho: konke okufuneka ukwazi malunga nesathuthwane vukuzenzele unnamed abantu abaninzi abanesathu thwane banokuphila ubomi obuqhelekileyo ukuba basela amayeza abo kwaye imeko ilawulwa kakuhle.

eng: according to dr nhlakanipho gumede, the clinical manager of medical services at harry gwala regional hospital in pietermaritzburg, epilepsy is not a psychological disorder, disease or illness, and it is not contagious.
xho: ngokokutsho kukagqirha nhlakanipho gumede, ongumphathi wezonyango weenkonzo zonyango kwisibhedlele sommandla iharry gwala emgungu ndlovu, isathuthwane akusikokuphazamiseka ngokwasengqondweni, sisifo okanye sisigulo, kwaye asosuleli.

eng: he explains that epilepsy is a neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance, loss of consciousness or convulsions, associated with abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
xho: uchaza ukuba isathu thwane kukuphazamiseka kwemithamboluvo okubonakaliswa zizehlo eziphindaphindanayo zesiquphe zokuphazamiseka kweemvakalelo, ukulahlekelwa yingqondo okanye ukuxhuzula, okunxulumene nomsebenzi wombane ongaqhelekanga engqondweni.

eng: "the brain comprises of billions of nerve cells (neurons) communicating through electrical and chemical signals.
xho: "ingqondo yenziwa ziibhiliyoni zeeseli zemi thamboluvo (iineuron) ezinxibelelana ngeempawu zombane kunye nemichiza.

eng: when there is a sudden excessive electrical discharge that disrupts the normal activity of the nerve cells, a seizure may result.
xho: xa kukho ukukhutshwa kombane okugqithisileyo ngokukhawuleza okuphazamisa umsebenzi oqhelekileyo weeseli zemithamboluvo, kunokubangela ukuxhuzula.

eng: "a single seizure does not necessarily mean you have epilepsy.
xho: "ukuxhuzula nje kube kanye akuthethi ukuba unesathuthwane.

eng: a diagnosis by a medical practitioner needs to confirm this," he says.
xho: ukuxilongwa ngugqirha kufuneka kuqini sekise oku," utshilo.

eng: according to epilepsy south africa, 80% of people with epilepsy will be able to control their seizures with medication.
xho: ngokombutho wesathuthwane emzantsi afrika, ama80% wabantu abanesathuthwane banakho ukulawula ukuxhuzula kwabo ngamayeza.

eng: causes and seizures the cause of epilepsy in six out of 10 people is not known.
xho: iimbangela kunye nokuxhuzula unobangela wesathu thwane kubantu abathandathu kwabalishumi awukaziwa.

eng: in the other 40%, it can be caused by a head injury, injury during the birthing process, alcohol and drug abuse, aging or a metabolic or biochemical disturbance or imbalance.
xho: kubantu abangama40%, sinokubangelwa kukwenzakala kwentloko, ukwenzakala ngexesha lokubeleka, ukusetyenziswa kakubi kotywala kunye neziyobisi, ukuguga okanye ukuphazamiseka okanye ukungalingani ekwakhekeni komzimba okanye iikhemikhali emzimbeni.

eng: dr gumede says the signs and symptoms of epilepsy vary, and can present in various ways, including generalised absence seizures (petit mal), when a person looks blank and stares; generalised tonicclonic seizures (grand mal), which commonly start with body stiffening, before the person falls down and has jerking movements; and complex partial seizures, which affect a part of the brain.
xho: ugqr gumede uthi iimpawu zesathuthwane ziyahluka, kwaye zinokubonakala ngeendlela ezahlukeneyo, kuquka ukuxhuzula okubizwa ngegeneralised absence seizures (ipetit mal), xa umntu ebonakala ngathi uhanjelwe ingqondo kwaye ethe phuhlu amehlo; ukuxhuzula okubizwa ngetonicclonic seizures (igrand mal), edla ngokuqala ngokuqina komzimba, ngaphambi kokuba umntu awe phantsi aze abeneentshukumo zokuxhuzula; kunye noku xhuzula okuyicomplex partial seizures, okuchaphazela icala lengqondo.

eng: a petit mal seizure only lasts a few seconds, and the person may be unaware that they had one.
xho: ukuxhuzula okubizwa ngepetit mal kuthatha imizuzwana embalwa, kwaye umntu usenokungazi ukuba unako.

eng: during a grand mal seizure, the person may have a blue colour around their mouth, which fades when normal breathing resumes.
xho: ngexesha lokuxhuzula okubizwa ngegrand mal, umntu unokuba nombala oluhlaza okwesibhakabhaka emlonyeni wakhe, othi uphele xa ukuphefumla okuqhelekileyo kuqalisa kwakhona.

eng: grand mal seizures usually last a few minutes.
xho: ukuxhuzula kwegrand mal kudla ngokuthatha imizuzu embalwa.

eng: "protect the person from injury by moving objects away and cushioning their head.
xho: "khusela umntu ekwe nzakaleni ngokubeka izinto kude kwaye uthintele intloko yakhe.

eng: don’t restrict their movement or put any thing in their mouth.
xho: musa uku thintela intshukumo yabo okanye ukubeka nantoni na emlonyeni wabo.

eng: help breathing by laying the person on their side when the seizure ends.
xho: mncede ukuba aphefumle ngokumlalisa umntu ngecala xa ukuxhuzula kuphela.

eng: food at school ensures children don’t go hungry vukuzenzele unnamed over nine million children receive a nutritious meal at school thanks to government’s national school nutrition programme (nsnp), which was introduced in 1994. the programme aims to improve children’s ability to learn, by reducing malnutrition and hunger and improving school attendance, especially at disadvantaged schools.
